name: Advance Shop
description: The Advance Shop, also known as the 100 Rupee Advance Shop, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. It is a unique store as it can only be accessed when the game is played on a Game Boy Advance.

name: Aboda Village
description: Aboda Village is a location is Spirit Tracks. It is located by the southwestern shore of the Forest Realm. It is Link's hometown and the starting point of his journey.

name: Ancient Tree Stump
description: The Ancient Tree Stump is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Abandoned Fort
description: The Abandoned Fort is a Keep in Hyrule Warriors.

name: Abandoned North Mine
description: The Abandoned North Mine is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ancient Shrine
description: Ancient Shrines are dungeon-like puzzles in Breath of the Wild.

name: Daqo Chisay Shrine
description: The Daqo Chisay Shrine, designated by the Trial name The Whole Picture, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ancient Columns
description: The Ancient Columns are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Darb Pond
description: Darb Pond is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Damel Forest
description: The Damel Forest is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Zora Seas
description: The Zora Seas constitute a vast sea in the land of Labrynna in Oracle of Ages. As the name suggests, the Zora Seas are home to the Zoras . The Zora Seas are found to the west of the Sea of Storms, from whence the water flows. To the north is the South Shore and the Fairies' Woods. The only noticeable landmark of the Zora Seas is the Eyeglass Island Library.

name: Hyrule Underground
description: The Hyrule Underground is a location in The Minish Cap.

name: Dalite Forest
description: Dalite Forestis a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Page 12
description: Page 12 is a location in Ripened Tingle's Balloon Trip of Love.

name: Ancient Harbor
description: The Ancient Harbor is a location in Skyward Sword. It is an ancient port which linked the land of Lanayru Desert to the ancient ocean, now known as the Lanayru Sand Sea.

name: Daqa Koh Shrine
description: The Daqa Koh Shrine, designated by the Trial name Stalled Flight, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Hyrule
description: The Kingdom of Hyrule, also simply known as Hyrule, the Land of the Gods, the Lesser Kingdom of Hyrule, the Surface, and Hyrule Kingdom, is the name of the kingdom that serves as the iconic setting for a majority of the games in the Zelda series. It is usually depicted as a beautiful and prosperous land blessed with deep forests, tall mountains, vast lakes, a barren desert, great cities, villages, and many ancient temples hidden throughout.

name: Pondo
description: Pondo is a character in Breath of the Wild.

name: Zora River
description: Zora River, also known as Zora's River, is a recurring location in the The Legend of Zelda series. It is one of the main bodies of water in Hyrule, with its water source being either Zora's Domain or Zora's Fountain.

name: Dako Tah Shrine
description: The Dako Tah Shrine, designated by the Trial name Electric Path, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Reesong Palace
description: Reesong Palace  is a location in The Wand of Gamelon. It the game's final stage and is unlocked after completing Shutoy Lake.

name: Hyrule Town Well
description: The Hyrule Town Well is a location in The Minish Cap.

name: Dark Ruins
description: The Dark Ruins is a location in A Link Between Worlds.

name: Hyrule Town Square
description: Hyrule Town Square is a location in The Minish Cap.

name: Dance Hall
description: The Dance Hall is a location in Oracle of Seasons.

name: Ordon Woods
description: Ordon Woods is a location in Twilight Princess.

name: Ordon Spring
description: Ordon Spring, also known as the Forest Spring, is a location in Twilight Princess. It is situated in the Ordon Woods and serves as the home of Ordona, the first Spirit of Light.

name: Ordon Village
description: Ordon Village is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. It is a simple village and Link's hometown located in southern Hyrule, just south of the Faron Woods. Its existence largely depends upon agriculture and ranching. It is here that Link's adventure to save Hyrule begins and is where he was brought up as a ranch-hand prior to the events of the game. A chance encounter with King Bulblin and his Bulblin subordinates sends the young hero on a quest that would begin with the rescue of his friends and ultimately expand to saving all of Hyrule.

name: River Source Pond
description: The River Source Pond is a location in the Plain of Andor in Zelda's Adventure. It is the source of the river that flows through the northern plain.

name: Zunari
description: Zunari is a character in The Wind Waker.

name: Page 11
description: Page 11 is a location in Ripened Tingle's Balloon Trip of Love.

name: Sahasra Slope
description: Sahasra Slope is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Passeri Greenbelt
description: The Passeri Greenbelt is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Page 1
description: Page 1 is a location in Ripened Tingle's Balloon Trip of Love.

name: Page 13
description: Page 13 is a location in Ripened Tingle's Balloon Trip of Love.

name: Ree Dahee Shrine
description: The Ree Dahee Shrine, designated by the Trial name Timing Is Critical, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Regencia River
description: Regencia River is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Tabantha Tundra
description: The Tabantha Tundra is a sublocation of Hebra in Breath of the Wild.

name: Popla Foothills
description: The Popla Foothills are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Page 10
description: Page 10 is a location in Ripened Tingle's Balloon Trip of Love.

name: Rebonae Bridge
description: Rebonae Bridge is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Rutala Dam
description: Rutala Dam is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Tabantha Bridge Stable
description: Tabantha Bridge Stable is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sah Dahaj Shrine
description: The Sah Dahaj Shrine, designated by the Trial name Power of Fire, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Symmetry City
description: Symmetry City is a location in Oracle of Ages.

name: Royal Ancient Lab Ruins
description: The Royal Ancient Lab Ruins are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sailing ship
description: The Sailing Ship is a location in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland.

name: Pond of Happiness
description: The Pond of Happiness, also known as the Wishing Well, is a Fairy Fountain in A Link to the Past.

name: Rutala River
description: Rutala River is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sakado
description: Sakado  is a location in The Wand of Gamelon. Along with Aru Ainu and Kobitan, it is one of the game's starting stages.

name: Swordsman
description: The Swordsman is a character in Majora's Mask.

name: Royal Chamber
description: Royal Chamber is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Hyrule Forest Park
description: Hyrule Forest Park is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Swiftblade School
description: The Swiftblade School is a location in The Minish Cap.

name: Suma Sahma Shrine
description: The Suma Sahma Shrine, designated by the Trial name Suma Sahma's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Riverside Stable
description: Riverside Stable is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Tabantha Hills
description: The Tabantha Hills are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Tabantha Frontier
description: Tabantha Frontier is a sublocation of Hebra in Breath of the Wild.

name: Subrosia Village
description: Subrosia Village is a location in Oracle of Seasons. It is located in central Subrosia. It comprises most of the Subrosians' dwellings and other establishments, which include a market, a smithy, and a smelting furnace.

name: Taafei Hill
description: Taafei Hill is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Hyrule Cathedral
description: Hyrule Cathedral is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Swamp of Evil
description: The Swamp of Evil is a location in A Link to the Past. It is the Dark World equivalent to the Desert of Mystery.

name: Tabahl Wasteland
description: Tabahl Wasteland is an area in Link's Awakening located directly north of the Cemetery on Koholint Island.

name: Sahasrahla
description: Sahasrahla is a recurring character in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Hyrule Castle
description: Hyrule Castle, also known as the Castle of Hyrule, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. It is the seat of Hyrule's monarchical government and the home of the Royal Family of Hyrule, which usually includes Princess Zelda and the normally unseen King of Hyrule. The castle first debuted in A Link to the Past, the third game in the series. Each game that contains Hyrule Castle features a different layout. Near the castle is Hyrule Castle Town, which serves as the city's marketplace where Hyruleans come to engage in business and trade.

name: Tabantha Great Bridge
description: The Tabantha Great Bridge is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sunshine Seashore
description: Sunshine Seashore is a location in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland.

name: Swamp Fishing Hole
description: The Swamp Fishing Hole is a location in Majora's Mask 3D. It is a Fishing Hole in the Southern Swamp operated by the Swamp Fishing Hole Man. Link can Fish here for 50 Rupees or for free by exchanging a Fishing Hole Pass. An oceanic counterpart, the Ocean Fishing Hole, is located in the Great Bay and operated by the Swamp Fishing Hole Man's younger brother.

name: Tabantha Tower
description: The Tabantha Tower is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Submarine
description: Submarines are giant floating Barrels in The Wind Waker.

name: Subrosian Volcanoes
description: Subrosian Volcanoes is a location in Oracle of Seasons. They are a chain of volcanic mountains in northern Subrosia. The Volcanoes are located beneath the Temple Remains. It is the first and last area of Subrosia that Link must explore on his quest. The Sword & Shield Maze, which contains the last Essence of Nature, is found here.

name: Hyrule Ridge
description: Hyrule Ridge, also known as the Hyrule Hills, is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Strock Lake
description: Strock Lake is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Symmetry Village
description: Symmetry Village, also known as Symmetry City in the present, is a village in the northeastern mountains of Labrynna, in Oracle of Ages. The most prominent feature of the village is its symmetric design, creating a perfect mirror image over the y-axis.

name: Subrosian Smithy
description: The Subrosian Smithy is a location in Oracle of Seasons. It is the only metalworking place in Subrosia, or even Holodrum. It is here that Link can get the workers to combine the Hard Ore and Wooden Shield in order to create the Iron Shield, and later, to get the Rusty Bell polished so that it will become the Pirate's Bell.

name: Hyrule Castle Town Ruins
description: The Hyrule Castle Town Ruins are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Subrosia
description: Subrosia is a subterranean lava world located beneath the world of Holodrum in Oracle of Seasons, and is home to the Subrosians. To outsiders, it is only accessible by travelling through seven Portals scattered across Holodrum. After General Onox causes the Temple of Seasons to sink, Link must travel to Subrosia in order to locate the temple and retrieve the Rod of Seasons. He must later return here to reach the Sword and Shield Maze, home to the eighth and final Essence of Nature.

name: Stinger Cliffs
description: The Stinger Cliffs' are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Hyrule Garrison Ruins
description: The Hyrule Garrison Ruins are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Hyrule Castle Garden
description: Hyrule Castle Garden is the area outside of Hyrule Castle in The Minish Cap.

name: Swamp Shooting Gallery
description: The Swamp Shooting Gallery is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Swamp Tourist Center
description: The Swamp Tourist Center is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Starlight Memories
description: Starlight Memories, also known as the Gerudo Jewelers, is a Jewelry Shop in Gerudo Town in Breath of the Wild.

name: Hyrule Field
description: Hyrule Field is a recurring large, grassy area that composes most of Hyrule in The Legend of Zelda series. It is the central region of Hyrule that leads to all of the prominent locations of the kingdom, and as such, Link must travel through Hyrule Field to reach villages, markets, and lakes, among other places. In Majora's Mask, there is a parallel version of Hyrule Field called Termina Field. Though the many game-specific regions of Hyrule often have a large field common to and one that connects all areas of the map, only those specifically labeled as Hyrule Field are of any significance.

name: Sunken City
description: Sunken City is a location in Oracle of Seasons.

name: Witch
description: The Witch, also known as Mapes in Lorule, is a character in A Link Between Worlds.

name: Sturnida Secret Hot Spring
description: Sturnida Secret Hot Spring is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Hylia
description: Hylia , also known as The Goddess, and later Zelda, is a goddess featured in Skyward Sword. She is depicted throughout the world by both statues and imagery, often as having had angelic wings and holding a sword in her right hand. Beginning as a divine entity, she was later, by her own choice, reborn into a mortal form as the first incarnation of Zelda, making her the true ancestor to the Royal Family of Hyrule and explaining the magical powers passed down within their bloodline. Hylia is eternally reborn.

name: Tabahl Woods
description: Tabahl Woods is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Subrosian Wilds
description: The Subrosian Wilds is an area in Oracle of Seasons. It is located to the far west of Subrosia. Within the wilderness is a Treasure Chest containing the precious Blue Ore, used to forge the Iron Shield. The area contains no other objects of note, aside from a Magic Ring. Its exploration is therefore optional.

name: Hyrule Castle Courtyard
description: The Hyrule Castle Courtyard, also known as the Castle Courtyard, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Windmill Hut
description: The Windmill Hut is a location in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Stockwell
description: Stockwell is a recurring character in the The Legend of Zelda series. He is a shopkeeper and proprietor.

name: Subrosia Seaside
description: The Subrosia Seaside is a location in Oracle of Seasons. It is located south of Subrosia Village and constitutes Subrosia's southern coast.

name: Subrosia Market
description: Subrosia Market is a shop in Oracle of Seasons. Located at very center of Subrosia in Subrosia Village, it is the only store in the entire subterranean world. The Market's exterior is designed to resemble a red-robed Subrosian.

name: Wild Tokay
description: The Wild Tokay is a mini-game appearing in Oracle of Ages.

name: StreetPass Meadow
description: StreetPass Meadow is a location in A Link Between Worlds.

name: Hyrule Castle Town
description: Hyrule Castle Town, also known as Hyrule Castle Town Market, Market, Hyrule Town,, Town of Hyrule, and Castle Town, is the capital of Hyrule located directly in front of Hyrule Castle. It is usually the main hub and center of activity in the Kingdom where Hyruleans come to engage in business and trade goods. The Town is considered to be one of the liveliest towns in Hyrule. The population consists mostly of Hylians, but as seen in Twilight Princess, Gorons commonly occupy the streets in hopes of selling their wares. In all the games in which it appears, Hyrule Castle Town is home to a wide variety of shops, side quests, and mini-games.

name: Sturnida Basin
description: Sturnida Basin is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Hyrule Castle West
description: Hyrule Castle West is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Swamp
description: A swamp is a region consisting of both plant life and water. Swamps are usually aligned with the elements of Forest and Water, along with aspects of Shadow. The water in swampy places is sometimes poisonous and it can harm Link if he makes contact with it.

name: Wetlands
description: The Wetlands are a location in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Stock Pot Inn
description: The Stock Pot Inn is a location in East Clock Town in Majora's Mask.

name: Stalry Plateau
description: Stalry Plateau is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Western Hyrule
description: Western Hyrule, also known as the Western Continent, is a location in The Adventure of Link.

name: Stone Watcher Island
description: Stone Watcher Island is an island found in the Great Sea of The Wind Waker.

name: Hyrule Castle Moat
description: Hyrule Castle Moat is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: House of Pirates
description: The House of Pirates is a location in Oracle of Seasons. As its name suggests, it is where the Piratians take residence.

name: Stone Tower
description: Stone Tower is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Strato
description: Strato is a character in The Minish Cap.

name: Wind Temple
description: The Wind Temple is a recurring Dungeon and Stage in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Station
description: Stations are stopping points for Trains in Spirit Tracks.

name: Star Island
description: Star Island is one of the islands of the Great Sea in The Wind Waker.

name: Stone Cache
description: The Stone Cache is a location in Skyward Sword.

name: Horseshoe Island
description: Horseshoe Island is a location in The Wind Waker.

name: Wind Shrine
description: The Wind Shrine, also known as the Wind God's Shrine, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. The Wind Shrine goes unnamed in Hyrule Warriors Legends.

name: Steamy Marsh
description: The Steamy Marsh is a location in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland.

name: Western Pool
description: The Western Pool is a small pond near Tingle's house in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland.

name: Horseback Archery Range
description: The Horseback Archery Range is a minigame in Ocarina of Time.

name: Statue of the Goddess
description: Statues of the Goddess are recurring pieces of architecture in The Legend of Zelda series. It depicts the goddess Hylia.

name: Star Belt Archipelago
description: The Star Belt Archipelago is a group of islands in The Wind Waker.

name: Windfall Island
description: Windfall Island is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. It is a market town in the Great Sea, and is known for having the highest population of all the islands in the game. People from all over the world come to Windfall Island, and as such, the town is always lively. Many sailors have found their way here, although their ships are never around.

name: Wintre Island
description: Wintre Island is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Statue of the Eighth Heroine
description: The Statue of the Eighth Heroine, also known as the Bronze Giant, is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Wind Ruins
description: The Wind Ruins are a location in The Minish Cap.

name: Holodrum
description: Holodrum is the land in which the events of Oracle of Seasons take place. The land's vibrant landscape is unique that it is affected by the four seasons, which begin change erratically when General Onox imprisons the Din and causes the Temple of Seasons to sink into underworld of Subrosia. Onox's ultimate goal is to create chaos in Holodrum in order to light the Flame of Destruction.

name: Western Fairy Island
description: Western Fairy Island is a location in The Wind Waker.

name: Whistling Hill
description: Whistling Hill is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Wiseapple Farm
description: The Wiseapple Farm is a location featured in the book The Shadow Prince. Situated in the middle of the Water Town of Saria's central square, it is composed of several trees that are on a small plot of land surrounded by a wide, square moat. This moat, however, is full of bubbling, green slime that radiates a "nauseating odor" from it.

name: Windvane Meadow
description: Windvane Meadow is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sage Temple Ruins
description: The Sage Temple Ruins are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: West Sokkala Bridge
description: West Sokkala Bridge is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Whittleton
description: Whittleton is a location in Spirit Tracks. It is a village located within the Forest Realm. It is known as Mayscore in the European version of the game.

name: Western Coast
description: The Western Coast constitutes the south-western border of Holodrum in Oracle of Seasons. Located directly west of Horon Village, it is one of the first explorable areas in the game. As such, it features only weaker enemies. In this area is a small pseudo-dungeon known as Hero's Cave, one of the first trials Link must face.

name: Wind Fish
description: The Wind Fish is a character in Link's Awakening. He is a large, flying whale, able to control the wind, who makes his home atop Mt. Tamaranch on Koholint Island, inside of the Wind Fish's Egg. He serves as the main focus of the storyline.

name: Ruto Mountain
description: Ruto Mountain is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Hylia Island
description: Hylia Island is a place in Breath of the Wild.

name: Western Wood
description: The Western Wood is a location in The Minish Cap.

name: Wetland Stable
description: Wetland Stable is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Hot Spring
description: Hot Springs are recurring locations in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Stolock Bridge
description: Stolock Bridge is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Hylia River
description: Hylia River is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Horwell Bridge
description: Horwell Bridge is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Hometown Prairie
description: The Hometown Prairie is a location in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland. It is located on the First Continent.

name: Stable
description: Stables are yurt-like structures found throughout Hyrule in Breath of the Wild. They are characterized by their giant, Horse-shaped rooftop decorations.

name: Horon Lagoon
description: Horon Lagoon is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: House of Skulltula
description: The House of Skulltula is a location in Ocarina of Time.

name: West Vatorsa Snowfield
description: West Vatorsa Snowfield is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Horon Village Shop
description: The Horon Village Shop is a shop located in Horon Village in Oracle of Seasons. Run by Stockwell, the main floor of the shop sells commodities such as Bombs and Hearts. A stairwell behind the counter leads to a basement floor where Stockwell sells special goods and operates the Treasure Chest Game. This area is reserved exclusively for Card-holding members.

name: Spring of Wisdom
description: Spring of Wisdom is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Hotel Oasis
description: Hotel Oasis is an Inn located within Gerudo Town in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ruto Lake
description: Ruto Lake is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: House by the Bay
description: The House by the Bay, also known as the Ghost's House, is a location in Link's Awakening.

name: Home of the Wind Tribe
description: Home of the Wind Tribe is a location in The Minish Cap.

name: Hollo
description: Hollo is a character in The Wind Waker.

name: Safula Hill
description: Safula Hill is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ruvo Korbah Shrine
description: The Ruvo Korbah Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Major Test of Strength+, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Horse God Bridge
description: The Horse God Bridge is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Spirit Spring
description: Spirit Springs are locations in Twilight Princess. They serve as the home of the four Spirits of Light, who each protect a province of Hyrule.

name: Horon Village
description: Horon Village is a location in Oracle of Seasons. It appears along the southern coast of Holodrum, and is the largest of the two human settlements in the land . The village itself is home to several important locations for Link: Vasu Jewelers, the Maku Tree, and one of the two stores in Holodrum, Horon Village Shop. The disharmony of the seasons causes distress among the inhabitants of the village. Ruul is the village mayor.

name: Honey
description: Honey is a character in The Legend of Zelda series. Honey goes unnamed in Ocarina of Time.

name: Hopper Pond
description: Hopper Pond is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sacred Ground Ruins
description: The Sacred Ground Ruins are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Spearfish Falls
description: Spearfish Falls is a location in The Faces of Evil. It is unlocked after completing Crater Cove.

name: Sacred Grove
description: The Sacred Grove, also known as the Ancient Grove, is a recurring location in the The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Rutile Lake
description: Rutile Lake is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Spring of Power
description: The Spring of Power is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sacred Realm
description: The Sacred Realm, also known as the Golden Land, is a holy world connected to the land of Hyrule, said to be the resting place of the Triforce. The three Golden Goddesses, once they finished the creation of the land of Hyrule and its inhabitants, left behind a symbol of their strength, the Triforce, before departing for the heavens. The land where they left behind the golden power was said to be the Sacred Realm. The realm is said to be of twilight golden skies rather than the blue of Hyrule.

name: Holodrum Plain
description: Holodrum Plain is a location in Oracle of Seasons. It is part of the vast land of Holodrum. The mid-western plain includes the home of Mrs. Ruul and the location where Link first meets Ricky. It is also the location of the Round Jewel. Holodrum Plain is mainly used as a thoroughfare when first accessing Spool Swamp and Tarm Ruins. The area becomes accessible to Link once he obtains the Power Bracelet from Snake's Remains, which allows him to remove an obstruction in North Horon and cross a bridge west onto the plain.

name: West Necluda
description: West Necluda is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Squabble River
description: The Squabble River is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Spring of Courage
description: The Spring of Courage is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ruto Precipice
description: Ruto Precipice is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: West Castle Town
description: West Castle Town is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sacred Forest Meadow
description: The Sacred Forest Meadow is a location in Ocarina of Time.

name: Spool Swamp
description: Spool Swamp is an area in western Holodrum in Oracle of Seasons. The area's default season is autumn. The game's third dungeon, Poison Moth's Lair, is located here.

name: Spool Bight
description: Spool Bight is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Waterfall of Wishing
description: The Waterfall of Wishing is a location in A Link to the Past.

name: Ruto Town
description: Ruto Town, also known as the Town of Ruto, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Spring Water Cave
description: The Spring Water Cave is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Rutimala Hill
description: Rutimala Hill is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Spirit Temple
description: The Spirit Temple is a dungeon in Ocarina of Time.

name: Spirit House
description: The Spirit House, also known as the Ghost Hut, is a location in Majora's Mask. It runs a battle-based mini-game.

name: Water Reservoir
description: The Water Reservoir is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Southern Tal Tal Peak
description: Southern Tal Tal Peak is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Spore Store
description: The Spore Store is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Southern Swamp
description: The Southern Swamp is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Spring of the Spirit Lanayru
description: The Spring of the Spirit Lanayru, also known as Lanayru Spring, is a location in Twilight Princess. It is situated in Lake Hylia, and serves as the home of Lanayru, the fourth Spirit of Light. This Spring is popular for Hylian citizens since it is here they can send prayers to the Spirit of Light.

name: Ocean Floor
description: The Ocean Floor is the underwater section of the Ocean Realm that goes below sea level in Spirit Tracks.

name: Southern Oasis
description: The Southern Oasis is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Northern Peak
description: Northern Peak is a location in Oracle of Seasons.

name: West Clock Town
description: West Clock Town is an area of Clock Town in Majora's Mask.

name: Spectacle Rock
description: Spectacle Rock is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. It typically appears as a mountain with twin peaks.

name: West Rospro Pass
description: West Rospro Pass is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Spirit Island
description: Spirit Island is an island hidden in the Southwest corner of the Southwest sea quadrant in Phantom Hourglass. Long ago, the three Servant Spirits came here in search of the power to defeat evil.

name: Northern Fairy Island
description: Northern Fairy Island is a location in The Wind Waker.

name: Wes Island
description: Wes Island is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sparring Hall
description: The Sparring Hall is a location in Skyward Sword. It is located on Skyloft to the right of the Knight Academy, presumably owned by Eagus.

name: Spectacle Island
description: Spectacle Island is one of the islands of the Great Sea in The Wind Waker.

name: West Loshlo Harbor
description: West Loshlo Harbor is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Waterfall Cave
description: The Waterfall Cave, also known as the Waterfall, is a location in Skyward Sword. Link's Crimson Loftwing is hidden here by Groose and his lackeys at the beginning of the game. It is also the home of the Moonlight Merchant.

name: Lorn
description: Lorn is a character in Breath of the Wild.

name: Southern Ruins
description: The Southern Ruins is a location in A Link Between Worlds. It is a region located in Hyrule and Lorule.

name: Waterfall Rapids

name: Nortinka
description: Nortinka is a location in The Faces of Evil. Along with Crater Cove and Goronu, it is one of the game's starting areas.

name: West Gerudo Ruins
description: The West Gerudo Ruins are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: High Spirits Produce

name: West Barrens

description: Wellspring Station is a location in Spirit Tracks. It is situated in the northeast section of the Snow Realm.

name: Northern Icehouse
description: The Northern Icehouse is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Water Temple
description: Water Temple is a recurring Dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Nuun Highlands
description: The Nuun Highlands are plains in Oracle of Ages. They are located just north of Lynna City.  These highlands appear only in the present, as Ambi's Palace takes their place in the past. The only notable location in the area is the Mask Shop, just outside Lynna City. The area is mostly inhabited by Buzz Blobs.

name: Wasteland Tower
description: The Wasteland Tower is a Sheikah Tower in Breath of the Wild.

name: Noya Neha Shrine
description: The Noya Neha Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Minor Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lookout Post
description: The Lookout Post, also known as the Observation Post, is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Hebra Tower
description: The Hebra Tower is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Washubi Swamp
description: Washubi Swamp is a location in The Wand of Gamelon. It is unlocked after Sakado is completed.

name: Ocean Fishing Hole
description: The Ocean Fishing Hole is a location in Majora's Mask 3D. It is a Fishing Hole in the Great Bay operated by the Fishing Hole Man. Link can Fish here for 50 Rupees or for free by exchanging a Fishing Hole Pass. An swamp counterpart, the Swamp Fishing Hole, is located in the Southern Swamp and operated by the Fishing Hole Man's older brother.

name: Well
description: The Well is a location in Link's Awakening.

name: Ocean
description: Oceans are large bodies of water which often connect to major landmasses in The Legend of Zelda series. Various oceans have appeared in the series, and they often are unique. They appear in The Adventure of Link, Link's Awakening, Majora's Mask, Oracle of Ages, The Wind Waker, Phantom Hourglass, Spirit Tracks and Skyward Sword; however they appear most in Phantom Hourglass and The Wind Waker, as most of the game is centered around the ocean and sea transportation, however the idea of using an in-game boat to navigate large waterways is also seen in games such as Skyward Sword as a minor form of transportation.

name: Lorule
description: Lorule  is the name of a kingdom that serves as one of the main settings of A Link Between Worlds. It is a dark mirror of Hyrule almost entirely congruous with the Dark World as featured in A Link to the Past. Lorule is accessed via fissures that appeared in Hyrule, caused by the wizard Yuga. Most of Lorule's locations are isolated from each other by cliffs and large chasms. They must be reached by separate fissures found across Hyrule, which appear following a large quake.

name: Lone Peak Shrine
description: The Lone Peak Shrine is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Hebra Plunge
description: Hebra Plunge is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lomei Labyrinth Island
description: The Lomei Labyrinth Island is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Northern Mountains
description: The Northern Mountains may refer to:

name: Lon Lon Ranch
description: Lon Lon Ranch is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. The ranch belongs to Malon and her father Talon, and is most famous for selling Lon Lon Milk.

name: Forest Realm
description: The Forest Realm is the southwestern quadrant of the re-established kingdom of Hyrule and the first region to be explored by Link in Spirit Tracks.

name: Lookout Platform
description: In the Great Sea of The Wind Waker, many Lookout Platforms protrude from the water. They can be found using the Platform Chart, and are inhabited by Bokoblins, Kargaroks and rarely, Wizzrobes.

name: Hickaly Woods
description: The Hickaly Woods are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: West Nabi Lake
description: West Nabi Lake is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Link
description: Link is the name shared by the main protagonists of The Legend of Zelda series. There are many incarnations of Link, each possessing the spirit of the hero, with some of them being blood-related as well. They are chosen by the Golden Goddesses to protect the land from evil whenever deemed necessary. They often need to complete a series of trials to mature into the chosen hero. In most games of The Legend of Zelda series, their adventures take place within Kingdom of Hyrule, traveling through the land, collecting important items, and defeating a wide variety of enemies while trying to save both Princess Zelda and her kingdom from the clutches of Ganon or other villains.

name: Hila Rao Shrine
description: The Hila Rao Shrine, designated by the Trial name Drifting, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Helmhead Bridge
description: Helmhead Bridge is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Forest Stage
description: The Forest Stage is a location in Ocarina of Time. It is located within the Lost Woods.

name: Hebra Tundra
description: Hebra Tundra is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Forest of Findo
description: The Forest of Findo is a location in Zelda's Adventure. It is located close to central Tolemac, between the Plain of Andor and the Meadow of Skotness.

name: Hermit Flat
description: Hermit Flat is a location in The Faces of Evil. It is unlocked after completing Lupay.

name: Lon Lon Meadow

name: Lodrum Headland
description: Lodrum Headland is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Hebra South Summit

name: Hidden Village
description: The Hidden Village, also known as the Bygone Village, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. It is located in the Eldin Province, north of the Bridge of Eldin.

name: Ruined House
description: Ruined Houses are locations in Breath of the Wild.

name: Fortress of Winds
description: The Fortress of Winds is a location in The Minish Cap. It is large complex that was once inhabited by the Wind Tribe; however, they abandoned it and traveled to the Cloud Tops, making it serve as the third Dungeon in the game. Instead of receiving the Wind Element from this Dungeon, which the Wind Tribe took with them to the skies, the Ocarina of Wind is obtained, allowing Link to fly to any uncovered Wind Crest in Hyrule.

name: Highland Stable
description: The Highland Stable is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Fountain of the Fortune Goddess

name: Hia Miu Shrine

name: Fort Hateno

name: Southeast Gate

name: Henhouse
description: Henhouses, also known as Cucco Shacks, and Anju's Henhouses, are recurring locations in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Forest of Time

name: Hebra West Summit

name: South Lomei Labyrinth

name: Fountain

name: Fortress Centrum

name: Royal Crypt
description: The Royal Crypt is a mini-Dungeon in The Minish Cap. It is the tomb of Gustaf, an ancient king of Hyrule, whose spirit provides Link with a golden Kinstone Piece that can be used to access Veil Falls.

name: Rupee Tower
description: The Rupee Tower is a location in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland. It is the structure that is destined to take Tingle to Rupeeland.

name: Forest Training Center

name: Forest Temple
description: The Forest Temple is a recurring dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Voo Lota Shrine
description: The Voo Lota Shrine, designated by the Trial name The Winding Route, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Forest Sanctuary
description: The Forest Sanctuary is a location in Spirit Tracks. It is situated in the Forest Realm past the Lost Woods, and it serves as the home of the Lokomo sage named Gage.

name: Royal Valley
description: The Royal Valley is an area in The Minish Cap located to the west of Hyrule Town. Gentari directs Link to the Royal Valley once he has obtained the first three of the Four Elements needed to create the Four Sword.

name: Southern Mine
description: The Southern Mine is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Forest of Torian
description: The Forest of Torian is a location in Zelda's Adventure. It is a densely wooded forest that makes up half of central Tolemac.

name: South of the Village
description: South of the Village is a location in Link's Awakening.

name: Ventest Clothing Boutique
description: The Ventest Clothing Boutique is an Armor Shop in Breath of the Wild.

name: Royal Family of Hyrule
description: The Royal Family of Hyrule, also known as the Hyrule Royal Family, is a long-running bloodline in The Legend of Zelda series. The Royal Family of Hyrule was established following the Era of Chaos, many years after the events of Skyward Sword. Descended from the Goddess Hylia, who was reborn as the first incarnation of Zelda, the Royal Family consists of numerous kings and queens, a Prince of Hyrule and many princesses who share the title of Princess Zelda . Keeping a close contact with the other leaders and races within the Kingdom of Hyrule, they rule over the land with the most prominent authority.

name: Rucco Maag Shrine
description: The Rucco Maag Shrine, designated by the Trial name Five Flames, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Rupeeland
description: Rupeeland, also known as Rupee Paradise, is a location in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland.

name: Soka Point
description: Soka Point is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Rupee Course
description: The Rupee Course is encountered at various points across the Great Sea. Two barrels with flags will rise from beneath the waves, and Link must sail between them to begin the course. Barrels will rise and Link must sail across them, collecting the Rupee floating above them, in order to make the next appear. First on the course come five green Rupees, then five blue, and finally five yellow.

name: Vatorsa Snowfield
description: Vatorsa Snowfield is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: South Shore
description: The South Shore is a location in Oracle of Ages.

name: Royal Water Park
description: The Royal Water Park is a location featured in the "Fairies in the Spring" episode of The Legend of Zelda TV series. It is being constructed per the orders of King Harkinian, who wishes to have a place where the citizens of Hyrule can cool off and have fun.

name: Soh Kofi Shrine
description: The Soh Kofi Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Minor Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: South Akkala Stable

description: The Village of Outcasts is a location in A Link to the Past. It is the Dark World version of Kakariko Village.

name: South Lake Akkala

name: Wahgo Katta Shrine
description: The Wahgo Katta Shrine, designated by the Trial name Metal Connections, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: North Dueling Peaks
description: North Dueling Peaks is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Volcano Summit
description: Volcano Summit is a large volcanic cavern found deep inside and near the crater of Eldin Volcano in Skyward Sword. As described by Ledd the Mogma, it is too hot for a normal traveler to explore. Link must travel through the summit many times in a row to extinguish the various pillars of flames that are blocking the path to the Fire Sanctuary where Din's Sacred Flame rests.

name: Viewing Platform
description: The Viewing Platform is a location in Skyward Sword.

name: South Clock Town
description: South Clock Town is an area of Clock Town in Majora's Mask.

name: Veil Springs
description: Veil Springs is a location in The Minish Cap, located at the top of Veil Falls.

name: Sokkala Bridge

name: Veil Falls

name: Uten Marsh
description: Uten Marsh is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Universe
description: The universe in which 'The Legend of Zelda' takes place. Although the connection between the various lands, worlds, dimensions, and realms is often ambigious, The Legend of Zelda Encyclopedia is the priminary source for the structure of the world. What follows is a basic overview of the Zelda universe structure and layout. For extended overview regarding the actual history of universe see the Zelda Timeline, and for extended history, lore, and culture regarding locations, see their corrosponding pages.

name: Village of the Blue Maiden
description: The Village of the Blue Maiden is a location in Four Swords Adventures. It is the second stage in Eastern Hyrule in Four Swords Adventures. The village has no enemies, other than the pair of Shadow Links as its boss. The many inhabitants of the area provide an altogether different experience, as much of the level consists of completing various tasks for village residents. The Moon Pearl and Dark World are introduced here. Most of the children of the village seem to be trapped in the Dark World, and thus a guild of secret agents, known as the Seeker's Guild, are investigating the mages in connection with the disappearance of the children.

name: Usotami Village
description: The Usotami Village is a place in Ripened Tingle's Balloon Trip of Love. It serves as home to the Usotami, striped people who have a strong tendency to lie.

name: Vision Henge
description: The Vision Henge is a location in Zelda's Adventure. It is a large stone henge that serves as the game's starting area, where Princess Zelda begins her journey in the land of Tolemac. It is also where Zelda fights Ganon after finding all of the land's Celestial Signs.

name: Linkle
description: Linkle is a playable Warrior in Hyrule Warriors Legends. She can be transferred over to Hyrule Warriors as well. She wields dual Crossbows as her weapon and uses them alongside quick kicks to attack enemies. Her story is described as a side story separate from the rest of the game's plot.

name: Vendoss
description: Vendoss, also known as the Forest of Aibon and Barachno Marsh, is a location in Zelda's Adventure. It is a large, heavily forested swamp located in southeastern Tolemac.

name: North Hyrule Field
description: North Hyrule Field is a location in The Minish Cap.

name: Linebeck Trading Company
description: The Linebeck Trading Company is a company located at the Trading Post. It specializes in trading train parts for treasure, although it also buys any kind of treasure from its customers. The company's president is Linebeck III, grandson of the company's original founder, the great captain Linebeck.

name: North Mable Ridge
description: North Mable Ridge is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Veiled Falls
description: Veiled Falls is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Link
description: Link is the name shared by the main protagonists of The Legend of Zelda series. There are many incarnations of Link, each possessing the spirit of the hero, with some of them being blood-related as well. They are chosen by the Golden Goddesses to protect the land from evil whenever deemed necessary. They often need to complete a series of trials to mature into the chosen hero. In most games of The Legend of Zelda series, their adventures take place within Kingdom of Hyrule, traveling through the land, collecting important items, and defeating a wide variety of enemies while trying to save both Princess Zelda and her kingdom from the clutches of Ganon or other villains.

name: North Aris Beach
description: North Aris Beach is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: North Horon
description: North Horon is a location in Oracle of Seasons. It holds a lake known as Eyeglass Lake, along with Gnarled Root Dungeon. When Link is transported to Holodrum by the Triforce, he awakens in North Horon, making it the first location seen in the game. Link meets Din and the Troupe of Performers here. Soon after, he witnesses the capture of the Oracle of Seasons by General Onox. In a Linked Game, the young hero also meets Princess Zelda here for the first time after saving her from the Great Moblin.

name: Valley of Death
description: The Valley of Death is a location in The Adventure of Link. It is located on the southern part of Eastern Hyrule.

name: Vacant House
description: Vacant Houses are recurring locations in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Nokani Forest
description: Nokani Forest is a location in The Wand of Gamelon. It is unlocked after completing Dodomai Palace.

name: Snow Realm
description: The Snow Realm is the northwestern quadrant of the re-established land of Hyrule and the second region explored by Link in Spirit Tracks.

name: Snowhead Region
description: The Snowhead Region is the northern area of Termina in Majora's Mask, where a strange change in the weather has turned the area from a calm spring to a raging winter.

name: Lantern Cavern

name: Light Tower
description: The Light Tower is a location in Skyward Sword. It is a tall, scalable pillar located near the southern tip of Skyloft. During Link's quest to rescue Zelda, he must activate the tower in order to infiltrate the thick layer of storm clouds enveloping the Thunderhead.

name: Lantern Lake

description: The Haunted Grove is an area in A Link to the Past and A Link Between Worlds located southeast of Kakariko Village.

description: The Forest Haven is a location in The Wind Waker.

description: The Rock Spire Shop Ship is a shop in The Wind Waker.

description: Hebra East Summit is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Haunted Wasteland
description: The Haunted Wasteland is a location in Ocarina of Time. It is a massive desert between Gerudo's Fortress and the Desert Colossus, far outside the land of Hyrule. As well as being extremely difficult to navigate, with a lack of landmarks and constant sand-storms, it is also said to be haunted. Due to this, the entrance to the Haunted Wasteland remains closed until Link shows his Gerudo Token to the Gerudo guard nearby. However, before opening up the gate to the young hero, the guard mentions to Link that he will not be able reach the Desert Colossus unless he passes a set of two trials: the River of Sand and the Phantom Guide.

name: Foothill Stable
description: The Foothill Stable is a Stable in Breath of the Wild.

name: Skyloft Bazaar
description: The Skyloft Bazaar is a location in Skyward Sword. It is an enclosed marketplace located in Skyloft. It features several Shops, or stalls, where Link can buy and upgrade items, as well purchase certain services. The stalls are operated by various inhabitants of Skyloft, known collectively as the Bazaar Peddler Association. The Bazaar closes at night.

name: Flight Control Platform
description: The Flight Control Platform is an island in The Wind Waker. It is a small wooden structure east of Dragon Roost Island where the Bird-Man Contest minigame is hosted.

name: Hateno Tower
description: The Hateno Tower is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Hateno Bay
description: Hateno Bay is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Floret Sandbar
description: Floret Sandbar is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sleepless Waterfall
description: The Sleepless Waterfall is a waterfall at the beginning of the Zora's River in Ocarina of Time.

name: Forest
description: Forests feature prominently in The Legend of Zelda series. Every game in the series features a forest, with the possible exception of Phantom Hourglass, which has only small islands, no named forests, and no large or dense concentrations of trees.

name: Snowpeak
description: Snowpeak, also known as Snowpeak Mountain and the Northern Mountain, is a location in Twilight Princess.

name: Shutoy Lake
description: Shutoy Lake is a location in The Wand of Gamelon. It is unlocked after completing Ahitaru.

name: Floria River
description: The Floria River is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Rowan Plain
description: Rowan Plain is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Rona Kachta Shrine
description: The Rona Kachta Shrine, designated by the Trial name Rona Kachta's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Underground Tunnel
description: The Underground Tunnel is a location appearing in The Shadow Prince. As its name implies, it is an underground maze-like tunnel filled with Stalfos.

name: Rohta Chigah Shrine
description: The Rohta Chigah Shrine, designated by the Trial name Stop to Start, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad expansion.

name: Rosso
description: Rosso is a character in A Link Between Worlds. He is one of the Seven Sages descended from those who sealed the Sacred Realm long ago.

name: Forest of Fairies
description: The Forest of Fairies, also known as the Fairy Woods, is a location in The Wind Waker.

name: Flight Range
description: The Flight Range, also known as the Rito Flight Range, is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Road to Mountain Village
description: The Road to Mountain Village is an area in Majora's Mask. Located directly north of Termina Field, it serves as the main passageway to the Mountain Village and the general Snowhead region.

name: Road to Southern Swamp
description: The Road to Southern Swamp is a location in Majora's Mask. Found at the southernmost extent of Termina Field, it leads directly into the Southern Swamp and associated regions.

name: Ukuku Prairie
description: Ukuku Prairie is a large field in the center of Koholint Island.

name: Rolling Ridge
description: Rolling Ridge is a location in Oracle of Ages. it is a large mountain range inhabited by Gorons located in the north-eastern part of Labrynna. There is a network of tunnels extending throughout the entire area, where the Gorons reside. The Switch Hook, which is found in the Skull Dungeon, is needed to cross the gap that leads to Rolling Ridge. Like most mountainous areas in The Legend of Zelda , Rolling Ridge is inhabited by Tektites.

name: Romani Plains
description: The Romani Plains are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Road to Goron Village
description: The Road to Goron Village is a location in Majora's Mask. It serves as the main passageway between the Mountain Village and the Goron Village.

name: Rodai Lake
description: Rodai Lake is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Robred Dropoff
description: Robred Dropoff is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Rospro Pass
description: Rospro Pass, also known as the Hebra Mountain Climbing Path, and the Snowy Mountain Climbing Path, is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: LD-301N Skipper
description: LD-301N Skipper is a robotic character in Skyward Sword. It is one of a race of Ancient Robots that are found primarily in the Lanayru Province.

name: Road to Ikana
description: The Road to Ikana is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Ulri Mountain
description: Ulri Mountain is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Slippery Station
description: Slippery Station is a location in Spirit Tracks.

name: Tunnel to the Tower
description: The Tunnel to the Tower is a location in Spirit Tracks.

name: Rok Woods
description: The Rok Woods are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Skeleton Forest
description: The Skeleton Forest is the Dark World counterpart to the Lost Woods in A Link to the Past.

name: Skyloft
description: Skyloft, also known as the Isle of the Goddess, is a series of large islands floating above the clouds in Skyward Sword. The main island includes the Skyloft Bazaar, a large residential quarter, a bathhouse, as well as a plaza and the Light Tower. Prominent features among the other islands are the Knight Academy, a boarding school run by Gaepora that Link and Zelda attend along with several other students, and the Isle of the Goddess, which holds the Statue of the Goddess.

name: Skull Lake
description: Skull Lake is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Shrine of Koridai
description: The Shrine of Koridai is a location in The Faces of Evil.

name: Trilby Valley
description: Trilby Valley is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sky
description: The Sky is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. where Skyloft and many other floating islands are located in Skyward Sword. It is also where the game indirectly begins.

name: Silent Realm
description: The Silent Realm is a supernatural region in Skyward Sword. Link accesses the realm by thrusting his sword on a Trial Gate, found by dowsing an area known to house a portal. The Silent Realm is a test forced upon Link by the Goddesses so that he can claim proof of his spiritual growth. Upon completion of each Silent Realm, Link is awarded a sacred treasure which allows him to traverse a region previously unexplored towards locating the Goddesses' Sacred Flames. The treasures garnered by the Silent Realms include the Water Dragon's Scale at Faron Woods, the Clawshots in the Lanayru Desert, the Fireshield Earrings at Eldin Volcano, and the Stone of Trials at the last Silent Realm in Skyloft. The Sky Keep provides access to three isolated areas of Skyloft's Silent Realm where the individual pieces of the Triforce are located.

name: Road to Snowhead
description: The Road to Snowhead is a location in Majora's Mask. As its name suggests, it serves as the main entry point to Snowhead from the Mountain Village.

name: Signpost Maze
description: The Signpost Maze is a location in Link's Awakening.

name: Shrine of Gamelon
description: The Shrine of Gamelon is a location in The Wand of Gamelon. It is unlocked after completing Gobiyan Ship.

name: Shuteye Inn
description: The Shuteye Inn is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Skyview Spring
description: The Skyview Spring is a location in Skyward Sword. It is a sacred spring located deep inside the Faron Woods. It is here where Link finds the Ruby Tablet, which makes a rift in the clouds leading to Eldin Volcano once placed inside the Statue of the Goddess.

name: Tuft Mountain
description: Tuft Mountain is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Natzu Prairie
description: Natzu Prairie is a location in Oracle of Seasons. It is located in central Holodrum at the base of the northern mountains. Natzu Prairie is one of three possible variations depending on which Strange Flute Link has obtained, along with Natzu River and Natzu Wasteland. Link must traverse through the area if he befriends Ricky and obtains his Flute, who is necessary to navigate the Prairie's landscape. If Link obtains Dimitri's Flute or Moosh's Flute, then the area will instead become the Natzu River or Natzu Wasteland, respectively.

name: Ubota Point
description: Ubota Point is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Simon
description: Simon is a character in The Minish Cap.

name: Ulria Grotto
description: Ulria Grotto is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Smithy
description: Smithy is a recurring location in the series. It may refer to either of the following:

name: Tutsuwa Nima Shrine
description: The Tutsuwa Nima Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Major Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Necluda Sea
description: Necluda Sea is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Underworld
description: The Underworld, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. It usually serves as the home of Ganon and his minions.

name: The Slippery Falcon
description: The Slippery Falcon is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Skull Woods Region
description: The Skull Woods Region is a location in the northwest corner of Lorule in A Link Between Worlds.

name: Shrine Island
description: Shrine Island is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Music Box House
description: The Music Box House is the home of Pamela and her father in Majora's Mask. It is located atop the valley of Ikana Canyon.

name: Shrine Waterfall
description: The Shrine Waterfall is a location in Link's Awakening.

name: Shrine of Resurrection
description: The Shrine of Resurrection is a location in Breath of the Wild. In The Champions' Ballad, serves as the starting point for the Divine Beast Tamer's Trial as well as the entrance to the Final Trial.

name: Naydra Snowfield
description: Naydra Snowfield is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lanayru Province
description: The Lanayru Province  is a recurring province of the Hyrule overworld in The Legend of Zelda series. The province is named after its original protector from the Era of the Goddess Hylia, the great Lightning Dragon known as Lanayru. It is later protected by the Light Spirit of the same name in the Era of Twilight.

name: Twilight
description: Twilight, also known as the World of Shadows, the Darkened Realm, and the Land Covered in Twilight, refers to any region of land stripped of Light. Under the effects of Twilight, inhabitants of the afflicted areas either turn into Spirits or monsters of shadow. Twilight is created and utilized by Zant to gradually cover the entire Kingdom of Hyrule in shadow during his conquest. The spreading Twilight becomes a serious threat to Hyrule that Link is tasked with combating. This Twilight is distinct from the twilight that naturally occurs during dusk.

name: Twilight Realm
description: The Twilight Realm is a parallel dimension to the realm of Hyrule. It is a world of shadows and perpetual twilight whose only source of light comes from the two sacred orbs known as the Sols that are kept in a shrine near the plaza of the Palace of Twilight. The Twilight Realm is the homeworld of the Twili, a race of shadow-beings descended from the Dark Interlopers that were banished from Hyrule and sent to the Twilight Realm as punishment for their attempted conquest of the Sacred Realm. The only link between the Twilight Realm and Hyrule is a relic known as the Mirror of Twilight, which acts as the one gateway between the two worlds.

name: Ukuku Plains
description: Ukuku Plains are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Tykogi Tower
description: Tykogi Tower  is a location in The Wand of Gamelon. It is unlocked after Aru Ainu is completed.

name: Lanayru Desert
description: Lanayru Desert is a location in Skyward Sword. Lanayru Desert is the centerpiece of the Lanayru Province.

name: Natzu
description: Natzu is a region in Oracle of Seasons whose landscape varies to suit the Animal Companion Link befriends. It is the Holodrum counterpart of the Nuun Highlands in Oracle of Ages.

name: Trill
description: Trill refers to two characters in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Lanayru Heights
description: The Lanayru Heights are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Nabi Lake
description: Nabi Lake is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Uncharted Island
description: The Uncharted Island is an island found in Phantom Hourglass. It is located in the eastern side of the northwestern quadrant of the sea.

name: Necluda
description: Necluda is one of the eight Regions in Breath of the Wild.

name: Trilby Plain
description: Trilby Plain is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Namika Ozz Shrine
description: The Namika Ozz Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Modest Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Nautelle Wetlands
description: The Nautelle Wetlands are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Tumlea Heights
description: Tumlea Heights is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ubato Hills
description: Ubato Hills is a location in Zelda's Adventure. It is a barren, mountainous plain to the northeast of Tolemac.

name: Lanayru Promenade
description: The Lanayru Promenade is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Natzu River
description: Natzu River is a location in Oracle of Seasons. It is located in central Holodrum at the base of the northern mountains. Natzu River is one of three possible variations depending on which Strange Flute Link has obtained, along with Natzu Prairie and Natzu Wasteland. Link must traverse through the area if he befriends Dimitri and obtains his Flute, who is necessary to navigate the River's landscape. If Link obtains Ricky's Flute or Moosh's Flute, then the area will instead become the Natzu Prairie or the Natzu Wasteland, respectively.

name: Nabooru Town
description: Nabooru Town is a location in The Adventure of Link. It is located in Eastern Hyrule. Since Nabooru is across the sea, Link must obtain the Raft from the Island Palace in order to reach this town.

name: Hanyu Forest
description: Hanyu Forest  is location in The Wand of Gamelon. It is unlocked after Washubi Swamp is completed.

name: Needle Rock Isle
description: Needle Rock Isle is an island in the Great Sea of The Wind Waker.

name: Lanayru Sea
description: The Lanayru Sea is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Muwo Jeem Shrine
description: The Muwo Jeem Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Modest Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mysterious Forest
description: The Mysterious Forest, also known as Mysterious Woods, is a location in Link's Awakening.

name: Natzu Wasteland
description: Natzu Wasteland is a location in Oracle of Seasons. It is located in central Holodrum at the base of the northern mountains. Natzu Wasteland is one of three possible variations depending on which Strange Flute Link has obtained, along with Natzu Prairie and Natzu River. Link must traverse through the area if he befriends Moosh and obtains his Flute, who is necessary to navigate the Wasteland's landscape. If Link obtains Ricky's Flute or Dimitri's Flute, then the area will instead become the Natzu Prairie or Natzu River, respectively.

name: Lanayru Great Spring
description: The Lanayru Great Spring is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Gut Check Rock
description: Gut Check Rock is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Nayru
description: Nayru is the name of two different people in the Zelda universe:

name: Snowfield Stable
description: The Snowfield Stable is a Stable in Breath of the Wild.

name: Fire Temple
description: The Fire Temple, also known as the Mountain Temple, is a recurring Dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Mysterious Pond
description: Mysterious Ponds are locations in A Link to the Past They are crucial during Link's quest. There are two Mysterious Ponds: one in the Light World known as the Waterfall of Wishing, and another one in the Dark World situated at the base of the Pyramid of Power. Both ponds have the same appearance from the inside, and they also house a Great Fairy within who will upgrade certain items of Link's inventory. The fairy asking a question about an item dropped into the water and giving a better item in return for an honest answer resembles the story, The Honest Woodman.

name: Music House
description: The Music House is a location in The Minish Cap.

name: Myahm Agana Shrine
description: The Myahm Agana Shrine, designated by the Trial name Myahm Agana Apparatus, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Harfin Valley
description: Harfin Valley is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Fir River
description: Fir River is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lanayru Mine
description: Lanayru Mine is a location in the Lanayru Desert region featured in Skyward Sword.

name: Lanayru Range
description: Lanayru Range is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lanayru Shipyard
description: Lanayru Shipyard is a location in Skyward Sword. It is located in the Lanayru Sand Sea.

name: Hateno Ancient Tech Lab
description: The Hateno Ancient Tech Lab is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lakna Rokee Shrine
description: The Lakna Rokee Shrine, designated by the Trial name Lakna Rokee's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Fifth Castle of Ancient Hyrule
description: The Fifth Castle of Ancient Hyrule is a location mentioned in the book The Shadow Prince. It is situated in the southeast corner of Hyrule, past many deserts, rivers, and swamps.

name: Harrow Island
description: Harrow Island is a location in Phantom Hourglass.

name: Faron Woods Entry
description: The Faron Woods Entry is a location in Skyward Sword.

name: Harker Lake
description: Harker Lake is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Hall of Secrets
description: The Hall of Secrets is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. It is located in the Maku Tree. There, Link can find Farore, the Oracle of Secrets. In a linked version of Oracle of Ages or Oracle of Seasons, Link can tell "secrets" to Farore to get special items and upgrades. These secrets are obtained in several different ways, but are only effective in the game opposite of the one they were found in. Any secrets Link obtains on his adventures will be recorded in Farore's Memory of the same game.

name: Harlequin Bazaar
description: Harlequin Bazaar is a location in The Faces of Evil. It is unlocked after completing Goronu.

name: Lanayru Sand Sea
description: The Lanayru Sand Sea is a location in Skyward Sword. It is a sea of sand located in the Lanayru Province. Link comes here to find Nayru's Flame, which is located aboard the Sandship. This Sandship belonged to Skipper and his crew of Ancient Robots, but was usurped by Ghirahim's forces and turned invisible. Link must expose and board the Sandship to obtain Nayru's Flame.

name: Guy
description: Guy is a character in Breath of the Wild.

name: Happy Hearth Inn
description: The Happy Hearth Inn is located in the eastern area of Hyrule Town in The Minish Cap.

name: Faron Sea
description: The Faron Sea is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lanayru Bay
description: Lanayru Bay is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lanayru
description: Lanayru may refer to any of the following:

name: Hammerhead
description: The Hammerhead is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Fire Mountain
description: The Fire Mountain is an island in The Wind Waker.

name: Lanayru Caves
description: The Lanayru Caves are a small network of caverns located in the Lanayru Desert region in Skyward Sword.

name: Rinu Honika Shrine
description: The Rinu Honika Shrine, designated by the Trial name Block the Blaze, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Rikoka Hills
description: The Rikoka Hills are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Happy Mask Shop
description: The Happy Mask Shop is a location in Ocarina of Time.

name: Guchini Plain Barrows
description: The Guchini Plain Barrows are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lanayru Bluff
description: Lanayru Bluff is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: First Continent
description: The First Continent is a location in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland.

name: Lanayru Gorge
description: Lanayru Gorge is a location in Skyward Sword. It is located in Lanayru Province just outside the Lanayru Caves. Lanayru Gorge is home to Lanayru, the Thunder Dragon. Like every area of Lanayru Desert, it is a barren wasteland in the present, but in the past it is full of life.

name: Region
description: Regions are eight locations in Breath of the Wild.

name: Firestone Lake
description: Firestone Lake is a location in The Faces of Evil. It is unlocked after completing Toyku Lighthouse.

name: Hanu Pond
description: Hanu Pond is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Fisherman
description: Fishermen are recurring characters in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Rito Stable
description: The Rito Stable is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Shoda Sah Shrine
description: The Shoda Sah Shrine, designated by the Trial name Impeccable Timing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Firly Plateau
description: Firly Plateau is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Guchini Plain
description: Guchini Plain is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Finra Woods
description: The Finra Woods are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Shira Gomar Shrine
description: The Shira Gomar Shrine, designated by the Trial name Aim for Stillness, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Firly Pond
description: Firly Pond is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Fire Sanctuary
description: The Fire Sanctuary is a location featured in Spirit Tracks. It is home to the Lokomo Embrose, guardian of the Fire Realm. It is located just behind the Goron Village and is the only sanctuary in Hyrule that does not have its own train station on the Rail Map.

name: Fishing Hole
description: The Fishing Holes, also known as the Fishing Ponds, are recurring locations in The Legend of Zelda series. They usually consist of a small, secluded areas in which Link, for a small fee, is allowed to roam freely and fish wherever he wants. The Fishing Holes are usually home to a variety of prizes that Link can receive by catching a record-size fish.

name: Sheh Rata Shrine
description: The Sheh Rata Shrine, designated by the Trial name Speed of Light, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Fire Realm
description: The Fire Realm is the northeastern quadrant of Hyrule and the fourth region to be explored by Link in Spirit Tracks.

name: Rimba Beach
description: Rimba Beach is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Figurine Gallery
description: The Figurine Gallery is a location in The Minish Cap.

name: Farosh Hills
description: Farosh Hills is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Festari
description: Festari, also known as Festa,) is a character in The Minish Cap.

name: Ship
description: Ships are recurring Objects in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Ritaag Zumo Shrine
description: The Ritaag Zumo Shrine, designated by the Trial name RItaag Zumo's blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Faron Woods
description: Faron Woods, also known as the Southern Wood, and the Skulltula Forest, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. As its name suggests, Faron Woods is part of and makes up a large majority of the overall Faron Province. It is home to one of the province's two protectors, Faron the Light Spirit. The other protector from Skyward Sword, Faron the Water Dragon, is located in the nearby Lake Floria. It takes its name from the province that it is a part of, which in itself is named after the Water Dragon.

name: Revali
description: Revali is a character in Breath of the Wild.

name: Fashion Passion
description: Fashion Passion is an Armor Shop in Gerudo Town in Breath of the Wild.

name: Shipyard
description: The Shipyard is a location featured in Phantom Hourglass.

name: Ripped and Shredded
description: Ripped and Shredded is an Armor Shop in Breath of the Wild.

name: Shoqa Tatone Shrine
description: The Shoqa Tatone Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Modest Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Rist Peninsula
description: Rist Peninsula is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Riola Spring
description: Riola Spring is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Risoka Snowfield
description: Risoka Snowfield is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Haran Lake
description: Haran Lake is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Trilby Highlands
description: The Trilby Highlands is a hilly area in The Minish Cap.

name: Ridgeland Tower
description: The Ridgeland Tower is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Richard
description: Richard may refer to any of the following:

name: Rin Oyaa Shrine
description: The Rin Oyaa Shrine, designated by the Trial name Directing the Wind, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: River of the Dead
description: The River of the Dead is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Rhondson Armor Boutique
description: Rhondson Armor Boutique is an Armor Shop in Breath of the Wild.

name: Training Dojo
description: The Training Dojo is a store in the Bazaar where Warriors can level up in Hyrule Warriors.

name: Rito Village
description: Rito Village is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Restoration Wall
description: Restoration Wall is a location in Oracle of Ages. It is located in the past and connects the northeastern sector of Talus Peaks to the otherwise unreachable Symmetry Village, and at its southwestern side even indirectly connects the Fairy Woods to these two other regions. This region, in specific, is known for its gargantuan rock wall, which can be climbed at one's risk, and its craggy, mountainous landscape, similar to Rolling Ridge, uncommon to the lush, diverse terrain of Labrynna.

name: Shora Hah Shrine
description: The Shora Hah Shrine, designated by the Trial name Blue Flame, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sharo Lun Shrine
description: The Sharo Lun Shrine, designated by the Trial name Blind Spots, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Town Tool Shop
description: The Town Tool Shop is the local Shop of Mabe Village in Link's Awakening. It is possible for Link to steal items from the Shop by either distracting the Shopkeeper or by using the Pegasus Boots. However, upon re-entry, the Shopkeeper will kill Link for stealing from him. In addition, every character will refer to Link as "THIEF" from that point on.

name: Rem
description: Rem is a character in The Minish Cap.

name: Retsam Forest
description: Retsam Forest is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sho Dantu Shrine
description: The Sho Dantu Shrine, designated by the Trial name Two Bombs, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Treasure Grove
description: The Treasure Grove is an area on the southwestern edge of Subrosia in Oracle of Seasons. The Strange Brothers, who use the grove as their backyard, take Roc's Feather from Link and bury it here.

name: Shai Yota Shrine
description: The Shai Yota Shrine, designated by the Trial name Shai Yota's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Shipwreck Cliff
description: Shipwreck Cliff is a location in The Faces of Evil. It is unlocked after completing Firestone Lake.

name: Faron Spring
description: Faron Spring is a location in Twilight Princess. It is situated in the southern portion of the Faron Woods. The Spring serves as the home of Faron, the second of the Spirits of Light.

name: Sheikah Tower
description: Sheikah Towers are recurring objects and locations in The Legend of Zelda series. Sheikah Towers go unnamed in Super Smash Bros. Ultimate.

name: Toruma Dunes
description: The Toruma Dunes are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Shark Island
description: Shark Island is one of the islands of the Great Sea in The Wind Waker.

name: Shee Vaneer Shrine
description: The Shee Vaneer Shrine, designated by the Trial name Twin Memories, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Shop Rafters
description: The Shop Rafters are a location in The Minish Cap.

name: Mount Taran
description: Mount Taran is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Shee Venath Shrine
description: The Shee Venath Shrine, designated by the Trial name Twin Memories, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Shop
description: Shops are recurring locations in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Sheem Dagoze Shrine
description: Sheem Dagoze Shrine, designated by the Trial name Moving in Parallel, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Shae Loya Shrine
description: The Shae Loya Shrine, designated by the Trial name Aim for the Moment, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sherfin
description: Sherfin is a character in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mountain Smithy
description: The Mountain Smithy is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Triangle Island
description: Triangle Islands, also known as the Triangle Isles, are locations in The Wind Waker. They are three islands shaped like triangles, in such a formation in the sea that if one were to draw lines connecting them, the result would also be a triangle.

name: Treasure Hunter Cave
description: Treasure Hunter Caves are locations in A Link Between Worlds. They are hidden miniature Dungeons that are found scattered throughout Hyrule and Lorule, each containing puzzles and treasures within.

name: Shadow Temple
description: The Shadow Temple is a Dungeon in Ocarina of Time.

name: Faron Tower
description: The Faron Tower is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mount Granajh
description: Mount Granajh is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Tower of the Gods
description: The Tower of the Gods is a sacred tower used by the Gods to test the courage of potential heroes. The tower's main item is the Hero's Bow, and the Command Melody is also learned here.

name: Traveler
description: Travelers are characters in Breath of the Wild.

name: Trendy Game
description: The Trendy Game is a shop and a mini-game in Link's Awakening.

name: Shae Katha Shrine
description: The Shae Katha Shrine, designated by the Trial name Shae Katha's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mozo Shenno Shrine
description: The Mozo Shenno Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Major Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lakebed Temple
