description: Lakebed Temple, also known as the Zora Temple, is the third Dungeon in Twilight Princess.

name: Treasure Chest Shop
description: The Treasure Chest Shop is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Shatterback Point
description: Shatterback Point is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Shai Utoh Shrine
description: The Shai Utoh Shrine,, designated by the Trial name Halt the Tilt, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Tower
description: The Tower is a location featured in The Shadow Prince. It is a tower situated in the most remote part of North Castle, "up a long, narrow, spiral staircase" where prisoners are kept.

name: Lake Totori
description: Lake Totori is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Triforce Room
description: The Triforce Room is a location featured in The Shadow Prince. Located in North Castle, it is the resting place of the Triforce of Wisdom, where it is safely kept away from the hands of Ganon. In order to hide the Triforce, there are three false Triforce Rooms scattered around the castle: the path from the throne room to the true Triforce Room passes over exactly ten diamonds.

name: Treacherous Tower
description: The Treacherous Tower is a location and mini-game in A Link Between Worlds.

name: Toyku Lighthouse
description: Toyku Lighthouse is a location in The Faces of Evil. It is unlocked after completing Nortinka.

name: Town Jail
description: The Town Jail is a location in The Wind Waker.

name: Lake of Ill Omen
description: The Lake of Ill Omen is a location in A Link to the Past.

name: Toto Sah Shrine
description: The Toto Sah Shrine, designated by the Trial name Toto Sah Apparatus, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Trading Post
description: Trading Posts are recurring locations in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Tower of Winds
description: The Tower of Winds is a level that appears in Four Swords Adventures.

name: Mount Hylia
description: Mount Hylia is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lake Kolomo
description: Lake Kolomo is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Town Shooting Gallery
description: The Town Shooting Gallery is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Mounted Archery Camp
description: The Mounted Archery Camp is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mount Rozudo
description: Mount Rozudo is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mount Floria
description: Mount Floria is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lake Hylia North
description: Lake Hylia North is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mountain Village
description: Mountain Village is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Moving House
description: The Moving House is a location in Four Swords Adventures. It was made by the Old Timer. The house itself is made of a special light, yet sturdy wood. The wood is also fireproof, which makes it able to have four blowtorches on each of the four sides on the roof of the house. As the name indicates, one is able to push or pull the house in different directions. If the four Links do so, the blowtorch on the opposite side of the Links will spurt fire.

name: Mount Rhoam
description: Mount Rhoam is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lakeside Laboratory
description: The Lakeside Laboratory is a location in Ocarina of Time. Located in the shores of Lake Hylia, it is home to a Lake Scientist who tries to resolve the lake's many mysteries.

name: Lakeside Item Shop
description: The Lakeside Item Shop is the name of two Shops in A Link Between Worlds.

name: Mount Lanayru
description: Mount Lanayru is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mountain Passage
description: The Mountain Passage is a location in Phantom Hourglass.

name: Toto Lake
description: Toto Lake is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lake Hylia Shop
description: The Lake Hylia Shop is a shop in A Link to the Past. It is identical in appearance to the Death Mountain Shop, consisting of a small cave-like enclosure. Like its Death Mountain counterpart, it sells the same wares as the Kakariko Village Shop and all three of them are run by identical shopkeepers.

name: Mount Faloraa
description: Mount Faloraa is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lake Sumac
description: Lake Sumac is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lake Illumeni
description: Lake Illumeni is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mount Daphnes
description: Mount Daphnes is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Great Plateau
description: The Great Plateau is the starting region in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mount Gustaf
description: Mount Gustaf is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mount Desma
description: Mount Desma is an area in the Third Continent in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland. The area is inhabited by the Yamatami Tribe. A notable feature of the area is the large amount of statues that can be drawn on the map.

name: Fairy Pool
description: The Fairy Pool, also known as the Fountain of Life, is a location in The Wand of Gamelon. It is unlocked after completing Hanyu Forest.

name: Lake Totori South
description: Lake Totori South is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Great Tree
description: The Great Tree is massive tree in the center of Faron Woods in Skyward Sword.

name: Mount Nabooru
description: Mount Nabooru is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lake Tower
description: The Lake Tower is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lake Mekar
description: Lake Mekar is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Realm of Memories
description: The Realm of Memories is a stage in Four Swords Anniversary Edition. In it, Link go through different areas from The Legend of Zelda, Link's Awakening and A Link to the Past. They are located in the Hero , Golden  and Silver  Doors respectively. Each door has three different levels, and unlike the main game, they are not randomized. Each one is longer and harder than the four main stages of the game, but they do not have bosses. The visuals of the game will change to suit each stage, with a monochrome scheme for the Game Boy levels, and 8-bit colors on the NES levels.

name: Lakeside Stable
description: The Lakeside Stable is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Great Swamp
description: The Great Swamp is a location in A Link to the Past. Its Dark World counterpart is known as the Plains of Ruin and serves as the home of the Swamp Palace.

name: Lake Siela
description: Lake Siela is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Rayne Highlands
description: The Rayne Highlands are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mount Dunsel
description: Mount Dunsel is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Fang and Bone
description: The Fang and Bone is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Rapids Ride
description: Rapids Ride is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. It usually refers to a location with river rapids in which Link can ride in a raft or a canoe, usually as part of a mini-game.

name: Mount Drena
description: Mount Drena is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lake Kilsie
description: Lake Kilsie is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Great Wimbich
description: Great Wimbich is a location in Zelda's Adventure. It is a bustling town located in central Tolemac. It is home to many shops that sell a variety of items and Spells.

name: Lake of the Horse God
description: The Lake of the Horse God is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Shadow Pass
description: The Shadow Pass is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Gubasha Desert
description: Gubasha Desert is a location in Zelda's Adventure. It is an expansive desert in the northeast of Tolemac, consisting of two areas. The North Gubasha Desert is a coastal plain near the sea, whereas the South Gubasha Desert is a vast canyon wasteland, and is home to a small desert village. The two regions connect from the north and the south.

name: Faron Highroad
description: The Faron Highroad, also stylized as the Faron High Road, is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Fairy
description: Fairies are a recurring race of creatures in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Grinnden Plains
description: The Grinnden Plains are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Raft Shop
description: The Raft Shop is a location in Link's Awakening. It is a small shop which can be reached by using the Hookshot to the east of Tal Tal Heights, or by using a cave north of the Face Shrine. In the shop, Link can rent a Raft for 100 Rupees and begin the Rapids Ride.

name: Great Sea
description: The Great Sea is the setting of the events of The Wind Waker. In Phantom Hourglass, the Great Sea only makes an appearance during the introduction and ending sequences of the game.

name: Lake Intenoch
description: Lake Intenoch is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Rauru Town
description: Rauru Town, also simply known as Rauru, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Lake Jarrah
description: Lake Jarrah is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Seres Scablands
description: The Seres Scablands are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Greatfish Isle
description: Greatfish Isle, also formatted as Great Fish Isle, is an island of the Great Sea in The Wind Waker. Once the location of a peaceful village of Hyruleans and Jabun, it is now a horrific wreck after being demolished by Ganondorf. Jabun fled the island and headed for Outset Island. Now, the only residents are a Traveling Merchant and the Korok Linder.

name: Guard House
description: The Guard House is a location in Ocarina of Time.

name: Fairy Garden
description: The Fairy Garden is a location in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland.

name: Great Zora Bridge
description: The Great Zora Bridge is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Torin Wetland
description: The Torin Wetland is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lake Saria
description: Lake Saria is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Great Plateau Tower
description: The Great Plateau Tower is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Mother and Child Isles
description: The Mother and Child Isles are a large island  and small island  situated next to each other in the Great Sea in The Wind Waker.

name: Faron Province
description: The Faron Province is a recurring location situated in Hyrule in The Legend of Zelda series. The Province is named after its original protector, the great Water Dragon known as Faron, from the Era of the Goddess Hylia and the Sky Era. It is later protected by the Light Spirit of the same name during the Era of Twilight.

name: Sha Warvo Shrine
description: The Sha Warvo Shrine, designated by the Trial name Path of Hidden Winds, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Fairy Spring
description: The Fairy Spring is a place appearing in the "Fairies in the Spring" episode of The Legend of Zelda TV series. As its name suggests, it is a spring located in Hyrule that is home to the fairies, including Spryte's sister and the king of fairies, King Oberon.

name: Fairy Island
description: Fairy Islands are heart-shaped landmarks on the Great Sea in The Wind Waker. They are the residences of the five different Great Fairies. While these islands may look alike, the method used to enter the Great Fairy Fountain is different for each, as is the equipment upgrade that Link receives as a gift for visiting each Great Fairy.

name: Moria
description: Moria is a kingdom mentioned in the book The Shadow Prince. Charles, one of the main characters of the book, traveled from the land of Moria to Hyrule as part of a custom that requires him to do good deeds in order for him to become the King of Moria. Not many details are given about where Moria is located except that it's "far away." However, later on it is discovered that Charles is actually Ganon in disguise, which heavily implies that Moria is a non-existant kingdom, especially since Princess Zelda had mentioned she had never heard of it.

name: Madame Fanadi
description: Madame Fanadi is a character in Twilight Princess.

name: Sera
description: Sera is a character in Twilight Princess.

name: Ravio
description: Ravio is a character in A Link Between Worlds. Originally a resident of the kingdom of Lorule, he spends a vast majority of the game posing as a simple shopkeeper in Hyrule, renting various items to his Hyrulean counterpart Link in order to help him advance in his quest. Ravio is frequently accompanied by his pet bird, Sheerow, who tends to mimic many of his gestures and emotions.

name: Rauru Hillside
description: The Rauru Hillside is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Seashell Mansion
description: The Seashell Mansion is a location in Link's Awakening.

name: Ralis Pond
description: Ralis Pond is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Moblin Cave
description: The Moblin Cave, also known as the Baw Wow Dungeon, is a mini-dungeon in Link's Awakening.

name: Fairy Fountain
description: Fairy Fountains are recurring locations in The Legend of Zelda series. They are magical springs found across many places of Hyrule which contain a small group of Fairies within. They can usually be found in Caves or by bombing certain walls to reveal the hidden entrance. They have appeared in almost every game in The Legend of Zelda series to date, providing a good source of healing for Link in which he can recover his hearts at once or store the Fairies in Empty Bottles for later use.

name: Rauru Settlement Ruins
description: The Rauru Settlement Ruins are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ranch Ruins
description: The Ranch Ruins are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Selmie
description: Selmie is a character in Breath of the Wild.

name: Faron
description: Faron can refer to any of the following:

name: Levels in
description: In Four Swords Adventures, Levels refers to chapters consisting of regional portions of Hyrule, which the Links travel to on their quest to save the Shrine Maidens and defeat Vaati. Each Level contains three Stages, which must be completed in order to progress through the Level. Upon the competion of the third Stage in a Level, a new Level and region of Hyrule is unlocked. There are a total of eight Levels in the game.

name: Lake Boruna
description: Lake Boruna is a location in Zelda's Adventure. It is a large lake located in the Vendoss swamp. A small island known as Mystery Island can be found in the middle of the lake.

name: Rassla Lake
description: Rassla Lake is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Rabia Plain
description: Rabia Plain is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Rainbow Bridge
description: The Rainbow Bridge is a location in Ocarina of Time.It is a temporary bridge conjured using the power of the six Sages in order to help Link reach the final dungeon, Ganon's Castle.

name: Moon
description: The Moon is the ominous object that threatens to destroy Clock Town in Majora's Mask. By the power of Majora's Mask, it is destined to crash into Clock Town, which will obliterate the town along with the rest of Termina.

name: Lake Floria
description: Lake Floria is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Second Continent
description: The Second Continent in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland is home to the three islands.

name: Shada Naw Shrine
description: The Shada Naw Shrine, designated by the Trial name Red Giveaway, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Serigon Caves
description: Serigon Caves  are a location in The Faces of Evil. They are unlocked after completing Spearfish Falls.

name: Serenne Stable
description: Serenne Stable is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Korok Forest
description: The Korok Forest is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Shadow Hamlet Ruins
description: The Shadow Hamlet Ruins are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Toronbo Shores
description: Toronbo Shores is a beach located in south-west Koholint Island in Link's Awakening.

name: Lake Ferona
description: Lake Ferona is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Faron Grasslands
description: Faron Grasslands is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Kolomo Garrison Ruins
description: The Kolomo Garrison Ruins are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Great Hyrule Forest
description: The Great Hyrule Forest is a sublocation of Eldin in Breath of the Wild.

name: Moruge Swamp
description: Moruge Swamp is a recurring location The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Secret Shrine
description: The Secret Shrine, also known as the Secret Shrine behind Waterfall, is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Monya Toma Shrine
description: The Monya Toma Shrine, designated by the Trial name Drawing Parabolas, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Monster Stronghold
description: Monster Strongholds are recurring locations in The Legend of Zelda series. Monster Strongholds go unnamed in Skyward Sword.

name: Toronbo Beach
description: Toronbo Beach is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mount Crenel
description: Mount Crenel, also called Mt. Crenel, is a craggy, mountainous area in The Minish Cap, located in the northwest corner of Hyrule.

name: Great Hylian Bridge
description: The Great Hylian Bridge is recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Moor Garrison Ruins
description: The Moor Garrison Ruins are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lake Akkala
description: Lake Akkala is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Granny
description: Granny, also known as Anju's Grandmother, is a recurring character in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Moruge Forest
description: The Moruge Forest is a forest found in Hyrule, and is the home to Bagu. It is first mentioned in an issue of the Valiant Comics, when Bagu visits the North Palace.

name: Koukot Plateau
description: Koukot Plateau is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lake Hylia
description: Lake Hylia is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. It is the largest body of water in Hyrule and is commonly guarded by the Zora people. Lake Hylia is usually home to an underwater temple that is guarded by the Zoras. Lake Hylia goes unnamed in The Adventure of Link and BS The Legend of Zelda.

name: Mother and Child Isles
description: The Mother and Child Isles are a large island  and small island  situated next to each other in the Great Sea in The Wind Waker.

name: Goronbi Lake
description: Goronbi Lake is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Great Ice Field
description: The Great Ice Field is a place featured in Phantom Hourglass. It is located on the eastern side of the Isle of Frost and can be reached through a cave once Link has talked to the Island Chief after he has revealed the disguised Yook. The Great Ice Field is the home of the Yooks and Link must defeat the six guardians of the field to gain access to the Temple of Ice and get the Azurine. Four Treasure Chests that contain one Power Gem, one Big Green Rupee and two Red Rupees are also located on the field.

name: Kuh Takkar Shrine
description: The Kuh Takkar Shrine, designated by the Trial name Melting Ice Hazard, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lake Darman
description: Lake Darman is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mogg Latan Shrine
description: The Mogg Latan Shrine, designated by the Trial name Synced Swing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Goron Shrine
description: The Goron Shrine is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Great Cliffs
description: The Great Cliffs are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Korgu Chideh Shrine
description: The Korgu Chideh Shrine, designated by the Trial name Korgu Chideh's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Koridai
description: Koridai  is the island which serves as the setting for The Faces of Evil.

name: Great Bay Coast
description: Great Bay Coast is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Goronbi River
description: Goronbi River is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Graveyard
description: Graveyards, also known as Cemeteries, are recurring locations in The Legend of Zelda series. They are locations where the deceased are buried, often in tombs with marked headstones. They are frequently haunted by ghosts and other undead enemies.

name: Kolami Bridge South
description: Kolami Bridge South is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Molida Island
description: Molida Island is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Labrynna
description: Labrynna is a land featured in Oracle of Ages. Like its sister countries of Hyrule and Holodrum, Labrynna is a vibrant country rich in beauty and resources. The land is bordered by a vast ocean, the Zora Seas, that flows to Labrynna's southern border, and the land is home to many interesting tribes such as the Labrynnans , the Zoras, the Gorons, the Tokay of Crescent Island, and many other citizens. Labrynna's most imposing feature however is perhaps the great Black Tower that stands at the center of the country, visible from almost anywhere, even from far out into the sea. Rich in history, Labrynna has had more than one type of a ruling government, originating with a monarchy several centuries in its past, but ruled in the present day by a republic, though it has always retained the same capital city seemingly, Lynna City . Curiously, the land of Labrynna is most notable for its deep connection to the flows of time  and is best known for being the home of the guardian of the flows of time, the Oracle of Ages, and the Oracle's protector, the Maku Tree.

name: Great Furnace
description: The Great Furnace is the location of the Subrosian ore-smelting forge in Oracle of Seasons. According to the Subrosians working in the forge, the furnaces are capable of melting any metal. On Link's adventures, it is used to smelt Red and Blue Ore into Hard Ore, which is needed to create the Iron Shield .

name: Grassland
description: Grassland is a location in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Koto Pond
description: Koto Pond is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Face Shrine
description: Face Shrine is the sixth Dungeon in Link's Awakening. It is the location of the Coral Triangle. The entrance, located in the Face Shrine region, is settled on a piece of land next to the cliffs separating it from the Rapids Ride. It is surrounded by some Armos, much like the area with the Southern Face Shrine, but to a lesser extent. The item hidden in this Dungeon is the L-2 Power Bracelet, while the mini-boss is a beast called Smasher. The Boss is Facade.

name: Kuhn Sidajj Shrine
description: The Kuhn Sidajj Shrine, designated by the Trial name Kuhn Sidajj's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Eldin Province
description: The Eldin Province is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. The province was named after Eldin, one of the three dragons of the Era of the Goddess Hylia.

name: Ku
description: Ku are recurring Enemies in The Legend of Zelda series. They are the Dark World and Lorule counterparts of the Zora.

name: Great Dry Canyon
description: The Great Dry Canyon is a location in Zelda's Adventure. It is a mountain path in Tolemac that leads to the Seacoast Plain.

name: Komo Shoreline
description: Komo Shoreline is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Eyeglass Island Library
description: The Eyeglass Island Library is a location in Oracle of Ages. It is situated on its own small island, named Eyeglass Island , which is found in the northern Zora Seas. The library is essential to the game's plot; it allows Link to cleanse the Zora Seas and enter Jabu-Jabu's Belly in order to obtain the penultimate Essence of Time, the Rolling Sea.

name: Korne Beach
description: Korne Beach is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Eldin Great Skeleton
description: The Eldin Great Skeleton is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Great Moblin
description: The Great Moblin is a recurring Sub-Boss in The Legend of Zelda series. He is depicted as a large Moblin that leads a troop of smaller ones.

name: Goronbi Lake North
description: Goronbi Lake North is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Eventide Island
description: Eventide Island is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Emerald City
description: Emerald City is a place in Ripened Tingle's Balloon Trip of Love.

name: Mount Agaat
description: Mount Agaat is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Kolami Bridge
description: Kolami Bridge is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Great Bay Region
description: The Great Bay Region, also known as the Ocean, and Great Bay, the Sea, is the western area of Termina in Majora's Mask. It is a large shore that makes home to the aquatic race of the Zoras, who live in the Zora Hall. Its hot weather, murky waters, and population of enemies now plague the Bay. The Great Bay is also home to the Gerudo Pirates, who live in their fortress.

name: Rabbitland Rescue
description: Rabbitland Rescue is a location in Spirit Tracks.

name: Exchange Ruins
description: The Exchange Ruins are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Eldin Mountains
description: The Eldin Mountains are a sublocation of Eldin in Breath of the Wild.

name: Quarry Ruins
description: The Quarry Ruins are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Great Hyrulean Sea
description: The Great Hyrulean Sea is a location in Link's Awakening.

name: The Great Deku Tree
description: The Great Deku Tree, also simply referred as the Great Deku Tree or Deku Tree, is the fatherly guardian of the forest who safeguards not only the dense land around him, but the small population of beings that live in his shadow. In Ocarina of Time, the famed Kokiri praise and worship the massive tree, sharing a home in the Kokiri Forest, while in The Wind Waker, these beings are none other than the Koroks, timid wood creatures who live collaboratively with the talking tree in the arboretum that is the Forest Haven.

name: Goronu
description: The search term Goronu may refer to any of the following area or boss in The Faces of Evil.

name: Elma Knolls
description: The Elma Knolls are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Puffer Beach
description: Puffer Beach is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Goron Village
description: Goron Village is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Kopeeki Drifts
description: The Kopeeki Drifts are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Gortram Cliff
description: Gortram Cliff is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Eldin
description: Eldin can refer to any of the following:

name: Goron Target Range
description: The Goron Target Range is a Mini-Game in Spirit Tracks.

name: Elemental Sanctuary
description: The Elemental Sanctuary is a location in The Minish Cap.

name: Private Oasis
description: Private Oasis, also known as Link's Oasis, is one of the islands of the Great Sea in The Wind Waker.

name: Eye Reefs
description: The Eye Reefs are minor islands in The Wind Waker that are located on various areas of the Great Sea and are uninhabited by civilizations, but guard Treasure Charts leading to Special Charts. Each Reef has a set of wall-mounted cannons that can be destroyed with Link's own Cannon. When all of the cannons are destroyed, a Treasure Chest containing a Treasure Chart will appear on one of the large structures. Link must then fly using the Deku Leaf to reach the Chest.

name: Goron Shop
description: Goron Shops are recurring locations in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Eldin Spring
description: Eldin Spring is a location in Twilight Princess. It is situated in the front entrance of Kakariko Village. It is inhabited by the third Light Spirit, Eldin, the protector of the Eldin Province.

name: Port
description: Port is a location in The Adventure of Link.

name: Quadruplets House
description: Quadruplets House is a location in Link's Awakening.

name: Qukah Nata Shrine
description: The Qukah Nata Shrine, designated by the Trial name Qukah Nata's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Eyeglass Pond
description: Eyeglass Pond is a region of North Horon in Oracle of Seasons. The region is named after a lake in the area, which features two parallel islands resembling a pair of eyeglasses. The first Portal to Subrosia can be found here, as well as the fifth dungeon, Unicorn's Cave, and the Square Jewel in a Linked Game.

name: Enchanted
description: Enchanted is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Savage Labyrinth
description: The Savage Labyrinth is a mini-dungeon in The Wind Waker.

name: Great Fairy Fountain
description: Great Fairy Fountains, also known as Faerie Springs, Fairy's Fountains, Fairy Fountains, and Great Fairy's Fountains, are recurring locations in The Legend of Zelda series in which a Great Fairy resides. Great Fairy Fountains go unnamed in Oracle of Seasons, Oracle of Ages, and Four Swords.

name: Etsu Korima Shrine
description: The Etsu Korima Shrine, designated by the Trial name Path of Light, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Qaza Tokki Shrine
description: The Qaza Tokki Shrine, designated by the Trial name Qaza Tokki's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Portal
description: The Portal is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Ends of the Earth Station
description: The Ends of the Earth Station is a location in Spirit Tracks.

name: Satori Mountain
description: Satori Mountain is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Equestrian Riding Course
description: The Equestrian Riding Course is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sealed Grounds
description: The Sealed Grounds, once known as Hylia's Realm, is a location in Skyward Sword. Located near the Faron Woods, it is home to an old woman and the seal that holds The Imprisoned.

name: Purifier Lake
description: Purifier Lake is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Eldin Volcano
description: Eldin Volcano is a location in Skyward Sword. It is the main feature of the Eldin Province, which is located on the surface world below Skyloft. It is home to the great protector of the Eldin Province, Eldin, the Fire Dragon. Deep within the volcano itself lies two of the game's dungeons: the Earth Temple near the top of the volcano and Fire Sanctuary within the Summit.

name: Empty Well
description: The Empty Well is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Sealed Temple
description: The Sealed Temple, formerly known as the Temple of Hylia, is a location in Skyward Sword. It is located in the Sealed Grounds, deep within Faron Woods, and is where Link initially meets the aged Impa. Zelda confines herself here in the past, where she enters into an era-long slumber until The Imprisoned is destroyed.

name: Post Office
description: The Post Office is a recurring location in the The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Sarjon Woods
description: The Sarjon Woods are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Eldin Canyon
description: Eldin Canyon is a sublocation of Eldin in Breath of the Wild.

name: Pumaag Nitae Shrine
description: The Pumaag Nitae Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Minor Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Proxim Bridge
description: Proxim Bridge is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sea Island
description: Sea Island is a location in Zelda's Adventure. It is a small island in the sea of Tolemac, where the Shrine of Water is located.

name: Seacoast Plain
description: Seacoast Plain is a location in Zelda's Adventure. It is a large coast to the southeast of Tolemac. It is home to a small harbor called South Port in the coast's south.

name: Rabella Wetlands
description: The Rabella Wetlands are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Pyramid of Power
description: The Pyramid of Power is a location in A Link to the Past. It is a huge golden pyramid in the Dark World which mirrors the location of Hyrule Castle in the Light World.

name: Sandship
description: The Sandship is the fifth dungeon in Skyward Sword.

name: Sea of Storms
description: The Sea of Storms is a raging section of the oceans of Labrynna in Oracle of Ages. It is located east of the Zora Seas, and west of Crescent Island and Crescent Strait. To the north is the South Shore.

name: Tingel Island
description: Tingel Island is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Eldin Tower
description: The Eldin Tower is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Scrap Shop
description: The Scrap Shop is a location featured in Skyward Sword. It is one of the many shops in the Skyloft Bazaar and is run by Gondo.

name: Misery Mire
description: Misery Mire is a location in A Link Between Worlds.

name: Protein Palace
description: Protein Palace is a General Store in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sasa Kai Shrine
description: The Sasa Kai Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Modest Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Qua Raym Shrine
description: The Qua Raym Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Balanced Approach, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Tolemac
description: Tolemac  is the land that serves as the setting of Zelda's Adventure. It is located in southeastern Hyrule.

name: Pumpkin Landing
description: Pumpkin Landing is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. Pumpkin Landing goes unnamed in Hyrule Warriors.

name: Sato Koda Shrine
description: The Sato Koda Shrine, designated by the Trial name Support and Guidance, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Pothole Field
description: Pothole Field is a field full of Grass and holes in Link's Awakening.

name: Thyphlo Ruins
description: The Thyphlo Ruins are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mine Entrance
description: The Mine Entrance is a location in Hyrule Warriors.

name: Toh Yahsa Shrine
description: The Toh Yahsa Shrine, designated by the Trial name Buried Secrets, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Seabed Inn
description: The Seabed Inn is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Thundra Plateau
description: Thundra Plateau is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Port Town
description: Port Town is a location in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland. It is located east of Hometown Prairie and it is filled with shops.

name: Kokiri Shop
description: Kokiri Shop is a shop located in the Kokiri Forest. Like all dwellings and houses in Kokiri Forest, the store is a hollowed tree. However, it has a red line painted around the top of it; along with an awning on which a Kokiri girl is perched, and a flat roof. At the beginning of his journey in Ocarina of Time, Link must visit this shop in order to purchase the Deku Shield for 40 Rupees, which, along with the Kokiri Sword, he needs to pass Mido and meet with the Great Deku Tree.

name: School of Joy
description: The School of Joy is a location in The Wind Waker.

name: Tingle
description: Tingle is a recurring character in The Legend of Zelda series. He is known for his flamboyant behavior, catchphrase, and outfit: red briefs worn over a green full-body jumpsuit with a pointy head and ears. He is often seen floating in the air, attached to a red balloon.

name: Mirro Shaz Shrine
description: The Mirro Shaz Shrine, designated by the Trial name Tempered Power, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sea of No Return
description: The Sea of No Return is a location in the past age of Labrynna in Oracle of Ages.

name: Kokiri Forest
description: The Kokiri Forest is a location in Ocarina of Time. It is located on the eastern section of Hyrule within the Lost Woods, with Hyrule Field to the west and Zora's Fountain to the north. It serves as the home of the Kokiri tribe as well as its guardian spirit, the Great Deku Tree. The Kokiri Forest is known to be the source of life, maintaining the order of the world and deterring outsiders from ever entering the so-called forbidden forest. The Forest serves as Link's hometown.

name: Throne Room
description: Throne Rooms are recurring locations in The Legend of Zelda.

name: Saria Town
description: Saria Town, also known as the Water Town of Saria, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. This small town crosses the river at the northern edge of Death Mountain.

name: Minish Woods
description: The Minish Woods is a forested region in The Minish Cap. It occupies the southeastern corner of Hyrule and is home to numerous Forest Picori living in the Minish Village.

name: Sand
description: Sand is an environmental element that has been a staple for The Legend of Zelda series. It has served numerous roles, including an environmental role and being an obstacle to beat.

name: Kitano Bay
description: Kitano Bay is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: To Quomo Shrine
description: The To Quomo Shrine, designated by the Trial name To Quomo's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Kochi Dye Shop
description: The Kochi Dye Shop, also known as the Dye Shop, is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Thorned Fairy Island
description: Thorned Fairy Island is a location in The Wind Waker.

name: Tingle Tower
description: Tingle Tower, also known as Tingle's Tower, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Sarjon Bridge
description: Sarjon Bridge is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Tingle Island
description: Tingle Island is one of the Islands of the Great Sea in The Wind Waker.

name: Koholit Rock
description: Koholit Rock is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Tokay Traders
description: Tokay Traders is a trading post found in past-age Labrynna in Oracle of Ages. The shop is located on Crescent Island to the northeast, on a small islet connected to the mainland by a bridge. The proprietor of the trading post is a Tokay. The only two items the shop sells are, in fact, Link's Power Bracelet and Roc's Feather, which were stolen from him by the Tokay when he washed up on the shores of the island.

name: Kema Kosassa Shrine
description: The Kema Kosassa Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Major Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mirror Chamber
description: The Mirror Chamber is a location in Twilight Princess. It is an ancient, open-air atrium located above the Arbiter's Grounds that houses not only the Sages, but also the Mirror of Twilight and is thus the only entrance to the Twilight Realm. Link cannot gain access to the Mirror Chamber until after he defeats Stallord, the boss of the Arbiter's Grounds.

name: Potion Shop
description: The Potion Shop, also known as Granny's Potion Shop, and the Kakariko Potion Shop, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Sanidin Park Ruins
description: The Sanidin Park Ruins are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Militron
description: The search term Militron may refer to any of the following area or boss in The Faces of Evil.

name: Goron Racetrack
description: The Goron Racetrack is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Milk Bar
description: The Milk Bar, also known as Latte, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. It is a drink restaurant that primarily serves Milk.

name: Thunderhead
description: Thunderhead is a location in Skyward Sword. It is a giant, billowing storm cloud near Skyloft. Around the outside of Thunderhead, tornadoes are common. On the inside of Thunderhead, plenty of lightning flashes occur, though they eventually stop once the parasite Bilocyte is defeated. The Sky Spirit, Levias, inhabits the area, watching over the Sky. The Thunderhead houses the Isle of Songs, Bug Rock, and several other islands, some of which contain Goddess's Treasure Chests. Although it is noted that the Thunderhead appeared suddenly in the Sky, there are no further details regarding its origin.

name: Misae Suma Shrine
description: The Misae Suma Shrine, designated by the Trial name Misae Suma's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Goron Hot Springs
description: The Goron Hot Springs are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mine
description: The Mine is a location in Hyrule Warriors.

name: King Zora
description: King Zora is a recurring character in The Legend of Zelda series. He is the leader of the Zora race.

name: Minshi Woods
description: Minshi Woods is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Kihiro Moh Shrine
description: The Kihiro Moh Shrine, designated by the Trial name Inside the Box, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Millennio Sandbar
description: Millennio Sandbar is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Minish Village
description: The Minish Village is a location in The Minish Cap. It is located in the Minish Woods, and is the capital of Hyrule's Minish world. Hyrule's original population of Minish founded this Village, which continues to thrive today, although many Minish have relocated outside of the Minish Woods since then. All Minish, since their expansion, categorize themselves based on location: those still living within the confines of the Minish Village call themselves Forest Picori, as do the many living in the outskirts and about the Minish Woods. The Forest Picori are supervised by their elder, Gentari. The architecture of the Minish Village ranges from hollowed out Barrels, habitable shoes, and mushrooms – anything in the area big enough to support the sedentary, minimalist Minish lifestyle. The Minish Village's existence is a secret to all but those with close ties to the Royal Family of Hyrule.

name: Knight Academy
description: The Knight Academy is a location in Skyward Sword.

name: Minish Realm
description: The Minish Realm is a location in The Minish Cap.

name: Goron City
description: Goron City, also known as the Home of the Gorons, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. It is the home of the Goron Tribe. It is located in close proximity to Death Mountain.

name: Kobitan
description: Kobitan is a location in The Wand of Gamelon. Along with Aru Ainu and Sakado, it is one of the game's starting stages.

name: Minish Door
description: The Minish Door, also known as the Doorway,, is a location in The Minish Cap. It is the magical gateway between the land of Hyrule and the Minish Realm.

name: Keya Pond
description: Keya Pond is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Koholint Prairie
description: Koholint Prairie is a location in Link's Awakening. It is southeast of Goponga Swamp, southwest of Tal Tal Heights, west of Tabahl Wasteland and the Graveyard, north of Ukuku Prairie, and east of the Mysterious Woods.

name: Gooey Swamp
description: Gooey Swamp is an area in the Second Continent in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland.

name: Moat Bridge
description: Moat Bridge is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Keo Ruug Shrine
description: The Keo Ruug Shrine, designated by the Trial name Fateful Stars, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Koholint Island
description: Koholint Island is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Egg Maze
description: Egg Maze is a location in Link's Awakening.

name: Goron Powder Keg Shop
description: Goron Powder Keg Shop is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Kiah Toza Shrine
description: The Kiah Toza Shrine, designated by the Trial name Master the Orb, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Ebara Forest
description: Ebara Forest is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Knuckel Island
description: Knuckel Island is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Goron Country Store
description: Goron Country Store is a location in Spirit Tracks.

name: Military Training Camp
description: The Military Training Camp is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Kema Zoos Shrine
description: The Kema Zoos Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Delayed Puzzle, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Goron Mountain
description: Goron Mountain is a snowy mountain range located in the northern part of Holodrum in Oracle of Seasons. As its name would suggest, it is home to all the Gorons of Holodrum, including Biggoron, who is the most noticeable feature of the mountain.

name: Eastern Ruins
description: The Eastern Ruins is a location in A Link Between Worlds.

name: King of Hyrule
description: The King of Hyrule was a wise ruler of the kingdom of Hyrule long in its past that was featured in the backstory of The Adventure of Link. He was the last in a long line of Kings who wielded the entire Triforce after Link reclaimed it in A Link Between Worlds.

name: Gorae Torr Shrine
description: The Gorae Torr Shrine, designated by the Trial name Gorae Torr's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Goron Island Shop
description: The Goron Island Shop is a shop in Phantom Hourglass. Located in Goron Island, it offers a wide variety of common items for sale, such as Bombchu and arrows. Once Link obtains Bombchu from the Goron Temple, the Goron Island Shop will put up a Bombchu Bag upgrade for sale at 1000 Rupees.

name: Goma Asaagh Shrine
description: The Goma Asaagh Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Major Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ketoh Wawai Shrine
description: The Ketoh Wawai Shrine, designated by the Trial name Ketoh Wawai's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: East Ranch Ruins
description: The East Ranch Ruins is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Keh Namut Shrine
description: The Keh Namut Shrine, designated by the Trial name Cryonis Trial, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Eastern Daval Peak
description: Eastern Daval Peak is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Goron Cave
description: The Goron Cave is a location in The Minish Cap.

name: Keive Tala Shrine
description: The Keive Tala Shrine, designated by the Trial name Big or Small, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Goponga Swamp
description: Goponga Swamp is a location in Link's Awakening.

name: Keep
description: Keeps are critical strongholds in Hyrule Warriors.

name: Milk Road
description: Milk Road is a road leading to Romani Ranch in Majora's Mask. It is located to the east of the Southern Swamp.

name: Goponga Village Ruins
description: The Goponga Village Ruins are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ploymus Mountain
description: Ploymus Mountain is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Eastern Hyrule
description: Eastern Hyrule, also known as the Eastern Continent, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Kincean Island
description: Kincean Island is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: East Hyrule Castle
description: East Hyrule Castle is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Gorko Lake
description: Gorko Lake is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Gorko Tunnel
description: Gorko Tunnel is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Goron Gusto Shop
description: The Goron Gusto Shop is a General Store in Breath of the Wild.

name: Eastern Hills
description: The Eastern Hills is location in The Minish Cap.

name: East Wind
description: East Wind is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Eddo
description: Eddo is a character in Phantom Hourglass.

name: Goponga Island
description: Goponga Island is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Gorman Track Rear Gate
description: The Gorman Track Rear Gate is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Pirate Ship
description: Pirate Ship may refer to any of the following:

name: Goro Cove
description: Goro Cove is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Eastern Fairy Island
description: Eastern Fairy Island is a location in The Wind Waker.

name: Sand Temple
description: The Sand Temple is a Dungeon in Spirit Tracks.

name: Gorman Track
description: The Gorman Track is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: East Necluda
description: East Necluda is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ebon Mountain
description: Ebon Mountain is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Eastern Coast
description: The Eastern Coast is a small beach on the southern border of Holodrum in Oracle of Seasons. It is located south of the Eastern Suburbs and is the only route to the eastern Samasa Desert. The only object of interest on the Eastern Coast is the gate barring the entrance to the desert. To open it, Link must push the four skull-shaped panels on the gate in the same order shown to him by the Piratians at the House of Pirates in Subrosia.  The correct combination for opening the gate is: the third panel from the left twice, the second panel once, the first panel twice, and the fourth panel three times.

name: East Gut Check Rock
description: East Gut Check Rock is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Goron Island
description: Goron Island is a location in Phantom Hourglass. It is found in the southeastern quadrant.

name: Percy
description: Percy is a character in The Minish Cap.

name: Golow River
description: Golow River is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Elde Inn
description: The Elde Inn is a location in Twilight Princess. It is a two-story inn that is located in Kakariko Village. By the time Link arrives to the village, the inn is now a desolate place that has been seemingly destroyed when the Shadow Beasts raided Kakariko.

name: Plain of Andor
description: The Plain of Andor is a location in Zelda's Adventure. It is an expansive, empty plain that makes up most of southwestern Tolemac. It is the starting region in the game.

name: Sale
description: Sale is a character in Link's Awakening.

name: East of the Bay
description: East of the Bay is a location in Link's Awakening. It is located east of Martha's Bay, hence its name. It is also south of Animal Village,  west of Yarna Desert and along the island's southern shore. This area is where Marin sings to the walrus in order to unblock the path to Yarna Desert. It features a warp hole, but little else.

name: East Mount Granajh
description: East Mount Granajh is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Eastern Abbey
description: The Eastern Abbey is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Thief
description: Thieves are recurring enemies and characters in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Egg Chamber
description: Egg Chamber is a location in Link's Awakening.

name: Pinnacle Rock
description: Pinnacle Rock, also known as the Sea Snakes' Lair, is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: East Reservoir Lake
description: The East Reservoir Lake is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: The Field
description: The Field is the first stage in Near the Fields in Four Swords Adventures.

name: Pirate Stronghold
description: The Pirate Stronghold is a mini-dungeon featured in Skyward Sword. It served as the headquarters of the gang of pirates led by LD-002G Scervo who took over Skipper's Sandship that protects Nayru's Sacred Flame.

name: Goron Graveyard
description: The Goron Graveyard is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Plain of Hobel
description: The Plain of Hobel is a location in Zelda's Adventure. It is a rocky plain located in eastern Tolemac.

name: Piper Ridge
description: Piper Ridge is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: East Sokkala Bridge
description: East Sokkala Bridge is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Pillars of Levia
description: Pillars of Levia is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: The Coast
description: The Coast is the first stage in Eastern Hyrule in Four Swords Adventures. After rescuing the Blue Maiden from Hyrule Castle, the four Links are told to travel by sea to enter the Eastern Temple, via The Coast and its neighboring town, the Village of the Blue Maiden.

name: East Post Ruins
description: The East Post Ruins are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Samasa Desert
description: Samasa Desert is an arid landscape in Oracle of Seasons. It is located in southeastern Holodrum and is reached from the Eastern Coast. The Piratians are shipwrecked here when sailing into Holodrum, driving their ship into the sand all the way through to Subrosia. They remain stranded here until Link finds the Pirate's Bell.

name: Eastern Suburbs
description: The Eastern Suburbs is a location east of Horon Village in Oracle of Seasons. It connects the village to the Woods of Winter to the north and the Samasa Desert to the south. Upon Link's first visit to the suburbs, he encounters Rosa, whom he follows into Subrosia for the first time. Guru-Guru can be found here playing his phonograph next to the Windmill.

name: Pirate Hideout
description: The Pirate Hideout is a location in Spirit Tracks. It also hosts a minigame.

name: Temple Remains
description: TheTemple Remains are a location in Oracle of Seasons. It is part of Holodrum's northern mountain range, located between Tarm Ruins and Goron Mountain. The Temple Remains are the former locale of the Temple of Seasons, which General Onox caused to sink into Subrosia when he captured Din. The General of Darkness has his castle built on the western peak of the remains, known as Northern Peak.

name: Pico Pond
description: Pico Pond is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Phalian Highlands
description: The Phalian Highlands are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Plains of Ruin
description: The Plains of Ruin is a location in A Link to the Past. It is the region surrounding the Swamp Palace in the Dark World and the dark counterpart of the Great Swamp.

name: Pierre Plateau
description: Pierre Plateau is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Tho Kayu Shrine
description: The Tho Kayu Shrine, designated by the Trial name Tho Kayu's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Midoro Palace
description: Midoro Palace is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Pillar Crossroads
description: The Pillar Crossroads is a location featured in The Crystal Trap. Princess Zelda stumbles into the crossroads after she leaves the Midoro Palace. Here, she finds tall stone pillars lying in a ring all around with strange writing on them. With three columns all pointing in different locations in which Zelda could go to, each column has a drawing pertaining to its area. For example, the road that leads into the Forest has a worn picture of trees and a deer.

name: Peak Province
description: The Peak Province is a province of the Hyrule overworld in Twilight Princess. It is located on the northwestern part of the map and is one of the smallest provinces of the game.

name: Piratian Ship
description: The Piratian Ship is a recurring wooden sea-faring vessel in The Legend of Zelda series. It is staffed by the Cap'n and his crew of Piratians.

name: Mijah Rokee Shrine
description: The Mijah Rokee Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Modest Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sand Sanctuary
description: The Sand Sanctuary is a location in Spirit Tracks. It is located within the Sand Realm, north of the waters of the Ocean Realm and is the home dwelling of the realm's Lokomo guardian, Rael.

name: Pawprint Isle
description: Pawprint Isle is one of the isles of the Great Sea in The Wind Waker.

name: Miiverse Gallery
description: The Miiverse Gallery is a location in Hytopia in Tri Force Heroes. It allows Link to post screenshots taken of the Drablands onto the Miiverse by speaking to its owner, Photo Bro.

name: Salvatore
description: Salvatore is a recurring character in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: The Slippery Falcon
description: The Slippery Falcon is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Pikida Stonegrove
description: Pikida Stonegrove is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Melari
description: Melari is a character in The Minish Cap.

name: Peak of Awakening
description: The Peak of Awakening is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sakon
description: Sakon is a character in Majora's Mask.

name: Samasa Plain
description: Samasa Plain is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: The Swamp
description: The Swamp is the second stage of the Near the Fields level in Four Swords Adventures.

name: Termina
description: Termina is the name of a parallel world to Hyrule and the setting of Majora's Mask. The land is filled with many characters similar in appearance to those introduced in Ocarina of Time. It is depicted with several diverse regions, each located in the four cardinal directions; including snowy mountain peaks to the north, haunted canyons in the east, forests and swamps in the south, ocean bays in the west, and the village Clock Town in the center. Termina is more technologically advanced than contemporary Hyrule, possessing modern hallmarks such as rock bands, motorboats, hotels, clocks, tourist shops, lotteries, Pictography, and even plans for space travel.

name: Thims Bridge
description: The Thims Bridge is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mekar Island
description: Mekar Island is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sand Realm
description: The Sand Realm is a location in Spirit Tracks. It is located between the Ocean and Fire Realms.

name: Salari Hill
description: Salari Hill is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: The Mountain Path
description: The Mountain Path is the second stage of Death Mountain in Four Swords Adventures. Following the foothills, eventually the Links get onto the mountain path. It is an dry and reeky area, much prone to rockfalls. The longtime guardians of the mountain, the Gorons, reside here as well. Once the four Links arrive, they're told by Kaepora Gaebora to help the Gorons who have been pestered by a giant bird.

name: Keelay Plain
description: Keelay Plain is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: The Great Ton Pu Inn
description: The Great Ton Pu Inn is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Sanctuary
description: Sanctuaries are recurring locations in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Termina Field
description: Termina Field is a location in Majora's Mask. It encompasses Clock Town and has many features.

name: Kakariko Village
description: Kakariko Village  is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. Its geographical and historical situation seems to change in each game. It may have been inspired by various towns in Zelda II: The Adventure of Link and, in turn, may have served as the inspiration for such future towns in the series – Mabe Village, Clock Town, Lynna City, Horon Village, Windfall Island, Hyrule Town, and various minor villages.

name: Salari Plain
description: Salari Plain is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mercay Tavern
description: Mercay Tavern is a location in Phantom Hourglass.

name: Temto Hill
description: Temto Hill is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Third Continent
description: The Third Continent in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland is home to three islands.

name: Mikau Lake
description: Mikau Lake is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mercay Island
description: Mercay Island is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: The Curious Quiver
description: The Curious Quiver, also known as the General Shop, is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: The Dark Cloud
description: The Dark Cloud is the second stage in the Realm of the Heavens in Four Swords Adventures. The first part of the stage plays in a side-scrolling perspective. After entering a beam of light to get to the next area, it returns to the traditional top-down view.

name: Kakariko Shooting Gallery
description: Kakariko Shooting Gallery is a location in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Kayra Mah Shrine
description: The Kayra Mah Shrine, also known as The Secret of The Hero and designated by the Trial name Greedy Hill, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ternio Trail
description: Ternio Trail is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Midla Woods
description: Midla Woods is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Goflam
description: Goflam is a character in Breath of the Wild.

name: The Noble Canteen
description: The Noble Canteen is a bar in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mezza Lo Shrine
description: The Mezza Lo Shrine, designated by the Trial name Ancient Trifecta, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Tenoko Island
description: Tenoko Island is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Gisa Crater
description: Gisa Crater is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mellie
description: Mellie is a character in Breath of the Wild.

name: Katosa Aug Shrine
description: The Katosa Aug Shrine, designated by the Trial name Katosa Aug Apparatus, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mimi
description: Mimi, also known simply as the Girl, is a recurring character in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Kara Kara Bazaar
description: The Kara Kara Bazaar is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mido Swamp
description: Mido Swamp is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Tetra
description: Tetra is a recurring character in The Legend of Zelda series. Orphaned at a young age, the young pirate follows her deceased mother's footsteps by becoming the captain of a ship with her crew of pirates, who all respect her deeply despite that she is much younger than them. Even though Tetra has a tendency to act tomboyish, take challenges head on, and even act bossy and cold-hearted sometimes, she actually has a kind and caring personality.

name: Mido Town
description: Mido Town, also known as the Harbor Town of Mido, is a location in The Adventure of Link.

name: Middle House
description: The Middle House serves as the town hall of Symmetry Village in Oracle of Ages. Like the rest of the village, the building is entirely symmetrical on the inside and the outside. At the far end of the house is a raised pedestal that holds in place the Tuni Nut, the city's greatly worshiped symbol that gives balance to the village. The house is inhabited by twin sisters, who will welcome Link to the village. Both the twin sisters have husbands who live on opposite sides of the village. The two husbands also happen to be twin brothers.

name: Midoro Swamp

Instead, it lies in the center of the Sacred Realm. It can be accessed only through the chamber of the Master Sword inside the Temple of Time. By withdrawing the Master Sword from the Pedestal of Time, a portal opens to the Sacred Realm, which leads to the Temple of Light.

name: Gerudo
description: The Gerudo, also known as the Female Pirates, are a race of thieves in The Legend of Zelda series. They live in a harsh desert that bears their name. The climate of the desert has made the Gerudo tough and resourceful. They are warriors by reputation, feared and respected in the countries they inhabit. Due to a unique biological quirk, the race consists almost solely of females. A single male Gerudo is born into the tribe every hundred years. This male is destined by Gerudo law to become their king. Ganondorf is the only Gerudo male to have appeared in the series.

Though some minor parts of the temple were destroyed in the process, all four Towers managed to stay intact.

After successfully completing it, Link will receive the first of the three Goddess Pearls, Din's Pearl.

name: Overworld
description: The Overworld is the vastest area that Link must explore in each game of the series. The most common example of an Overworld location would be the land of Hyrule, but others include Termina, the Great Sea, and Koholint. It is through the Overworld that Link can access other areas such as caves and dungeons. The Overworld mostly consists of locations above ground, and it is separate from Dungeons. In contrast to Dungeons, which are isolated and explored from a beginning to an end point, the Overworld is much larger with more open-ended exploration. Since Ocarina of Time, it has been common for the Overworld of a title to include a type of hub most Overworld areas connect to, such as Hyrule Field. As mentioned, there are multiple Overworld settings to be explored with many ways to traverse their varying topography.

On this island, it is customary to garb boys in green when they reach the age of the fabled "legendary hero."

Link must travel to the Isle of Songs to progress further in his quest to temper the Goddess Sword. Entrance to the Thunderhead is possible after acquiring the Goddess's Harp and activating the mirror on top of the Light Tower by playing the Ballad of the Goddess.

To be able to reach the island, many dangerous places must be crossed, including a desert, a ravaging sea, and dark caves. A man  is disguised as an Iron Knuckle, and was charged by a past king to protect the treasure that rests there.

name: Impa

Many Sheikah so far has been associated with and taken on the role of taking care of an incarnation of Zelda, being a nanny and a bodyguard of sorts in some games. In addition, every Impa has given extensive information and guidance to the various incarnations of Link they encounter in their time.

name: Malo Mart

name: Isle of the Dead
description: The Isle of the Dead is an island in Phantom Hourglass. It can be found once Link has obtained the Northeastern Sea Chart and is notably shaped like King Mutoh's skull. Located on the Isle of the Dead is the Sage's Graveyard, the Phantom Hallway, the Rupoor Maze, and many secret passages under the surface of the island. Stalfos are the main enemy on this island. Found in the Phantom Hallway is the ghost of the fourth knight, Brant, who opens the way to the Regal Necklace.

name: Levels in
description: In Four Swords Adventures, Levels refers to chapters consisting of regional portions of Hyrule, which the Links travel to on their quest to save the Shrine Maidens and defeat Vaati. Each Level contains three Stages, which must be completed in order to progress through the Level. Upon the competion of the third Stage in a Level, a new Level and region of Hyrule is unlocked. There are a total of eight Levels in the game.
