description: The Illusory Realm is a location in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Islet of Steel
description: The Islet of Steel is one of the Great Sea islands in The Wind Waker.

name: Deku Forest
description: The Deku Forest is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Inogo Bridge
description: Inogo Bridge is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Mable Ridge
description: Mable Ridge is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Gamelon
description: Gamelon  is an island territory which serves as the setting for The Wand of Gamelon.

name: Four Sword Sanctuary
description: The Four Sword Sanctuary, also known as the Four Sword Shrine, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series, and is the resting place of the Four Sword. Legend states that a hero  used this blade to vanquish Vaati, and sealed him inside the blade. He then placed the sword in a remote part of Hyrule to bind the Wind Sorcerer completely. Over time, the people built a shrine around the pedestal where the blade was placed, thus giving rise to the Four Sword Sanctuary. It can be seen housing the four Royal Jewels used to summon the Tower of Winds, an entrance to the Realm of the Heavens, and also contains a carved image of Vaati's sealing on its back wall.

name: Diamond Steppe Island
description: Diamond Steppe Island is a diamond-shaped island in The Wind Waker.

name: Desert of Doubt (Stage)
description: The Desert of Doubt is the first stage of the eponymous level in Four Swords Adventures. The Gerudo tribe can be found in a village near the beginning of this stage. The village is in a bit of an uproar after Ganondorf, guardian of the Gerudo and the desert, left for the Pyramid against local laws. It is revealed that Ganondorf left in pursuit of power, and the Gerudo blocked the road to the desert to prevent others from doing so. In order to pass into the desert, the Links must ask permission from the leader of the tribe, who allows them to enter because of the crisis in Hyrule.

name: Digdogg Suspension Bridge
description: The Digdogg Suspension Bridge is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Fural Plain
description: The Fural Plain is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Isle of Gust
description: The Isle of Gust is a location in Phantom Hourglass. It is an island located in the northwestern quadrant of the Sea.

name: Oocca Pod Shop
description: The Oocca Pod Shop is a location in Twilight Princess. Situated in the City in the Sky, it is the only shop in the dungeon and can be found on the first floor.

name: Dodomai Palace
description: Dodomai Palace is a location in The Wand of Gamelon. It is unlocked after completing Dordung Cave.

name: In the Woods
description: In the Woods is a location in Skyward Sword.

name: Old Man Ulrira
description: Old Man Ulrira, also known as Grandpa Ulrira, is a character in Link's Awakening.

name: Desert
description: The Desert is a location in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Dig Cavern
description: Dig Caverns, also known as Secret Grotto, Grotto, Secret Caves, and Secret Caverns, are a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Doggy Racetrack
description: The Doggy Racetrack is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Deya Lake
description: Deya Lake is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Deepwood Shrine
description: The Deepwood Shrine is the first Dungeon within The Minish Cap. It is a Minish-size Dungeon located behind the lost city of the Minish deep within the Minish Woods. It was once a meeting place between Minish and humans.

name: Lulu Lake
description: Lulu Lake is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Dila Maag Shrine
description: The Dila Maag Shrine, designated by the Trial name Dila Maag's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ganon
description: Ganon, also known by his original/human form Ganondorf, is the main antagonist of The Legend of Zelda series. Ganon is a nickname for Ganondorf and the name given to him when he transforms into a boar-like beast. He made his debut appearance in the first game, The Legend of Zelda, and has since been present or referred to in most subsequent iterations.

name: Deplian Badlands
description: The Deplian Badlands are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Deku Elementary
description: Deku Elementary is a location mentioned in Majora's Mask.

name: Lorule Lake
description: Lorule Lake is a location in A Link Between Worlds.

name: Desert Caravan
description: Desert Caravan, also known as the Arbiter's Grounds, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Desert Colossus
description: The Desert Colossus is a location in Ocarina of Time. It is also the name of a similar statue inside of the Spirit Temple.

name: Gear Shop
description: The Gear Shop location featured in Skyward Sword. It is one of the many shops in the Skyloft Bazaar and is run by Rupin.

name: Ikana Graveyard
description: The Ikana Graveyard is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Oceanside Spider House
description: The Oceanside Spider House is a location and a mini-dungeon in Majora's Mask. It is located near the Fisherman's Hut in the Great Bay Coast. It is full of Gold Skulltulas that have cast a curse upon the house. In order to get to the inner part of the Spider House, the entrance must be blown up using a Bomb. The Hookshot is also required to proceed further.

name: Deku Palace
description: Deku Palace is a location in Majora's Mask. It is located deep within the Southern Swamp.

name: Ice Ring Isle
description: The Ice Ring Isle is an island in The Wind Waker. It is the location of the Iron Boots, and is explored in a similar way the Fire Mountain is. The cold island is one square west of Forest Haven.

name: Funday School
description: Funday School is a location in The Minish Cap.

name: Deku Kingdom
description: The Deku Kingdom is the monarchy presiding over the Southern Swamp and Woodfall regions of Termina in Majora's Mask. Its Royal Family consists of a wrathful Deku King and his fiery daughter, who reside in the Deku Palace.

name: Lost Woods
description: The Lost Woods is a maze-like area of a confusing forest that has made several appearances throughout The Legend of Zelda series. Its layout is usually designed to make anyone who enters to become irreversibly lost, and the only way to exit the forest is by navigating it in specific directions. In certain games, it is said that if people wander in the forest for too long, they can turn into a monster such as a Skull Kid, a Stalfos, or a Deku Scrub.

name: Ocean Temple
description: The Ocean Temple is the third Dungeon in Spirit Tracks.

name: Loshlo Harbor
description: Loshlo Harbor is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ice Lake
description: The Ice Lake is an area of the Dark World in A Link to the Past. It is the Dark World counterpart of Lake Hylia, and as such shares many similar landmarks. It is also where the Ice Palace is located.

name: Deya Village Ruins
description: The Deya Village Ruins are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Deepback Bay
description: Deepback Bay is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Hytopia Castle Town
description: Hytopia Castle Town is a location in Tri Force Heroes.

name: Disorientation Station
description: Disorientation Station is a location in Spirit Tracks.

name: Ikana River
description: The Ikana River is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Old Man
description: Old Men are recurring characters in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Icy Plain
description: The Icy Plain is a location in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland.

name: Death Mountain Foothills
description: Death Mountain Foothills is the first stage of Death Mountain in Four Swords Adventures.

name: Old Kasuto
description: Old Kasuto, also simply known as Kasuto, is a location in The Adventure of Link.

name: Desert Province
description: The Desert Province is a province of the Hyrule overworld in Twilight Princess.

name: Lottery Shop
description: The Lottery Shop is a location in Majora's Mask. It is manned by the Lottery Shop Attendant, who is a person listed in the Bombers' Notebook, but is never seen.

name: Death Mountain Shop
description: The Death Mountain Shop is a Light World shop in A Link to the Past. It is identical in appearance to the Death Mountain Shop, consisting of a small cave-like enclosure. Like its Death Mountain counterpart, it sells the same wares as the Kakariko Village Shop and all three of them are run by identical shopkeepers.

name: Lumpy Pumpkin
description: The Lumpy Pumpkin is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. The Lumpy Pumpkin goes unnamed in Hyrule Warriors.

name: Deku Shrine
description: The Deku Shrine is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Lorule Castle
description: Lorule Castle is a location and the final Dungeon in A Link Between Worlds. It is Lorule's incarnation of Hyrule Castle and thus is the home of the Royal Family of Lorule. The final room of the Castle, the Throne Room where Yuga Ganon is battled, is demarcated as a separate Dungeon.

name: Ice Cave
description: The Ice Cave is a location in A Link to the Past. It is a mysterious frozen cave on the eastern side of Lake Hylia.

name: Death Caldera
description: Death Caldera is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Illumeni Plateau
description: Illumeni Plateau is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lupay
description: Lupay may refer to any of the following area or boss in The Faces of Evil.

name: Ordon Ranch
description: Ordon Ranch is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. Ordon Ranch goes unnamed in Link's Crossbow Training.

name: Oman Au Shrine
description: The Oman Au Shrine, designated by the Trial name Magnesis Trial, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ikana Kingdom
description: The Ikana Kingdom, also known as the Kingdom of Ikana, is a monarchy that appears only in Majora's Mask.

name: Dark Tower
description: The Dark Tower is a location featured in The Crystal Trap. Situated in the main street of the Town of Ruto, it is the resting place of Ganon's Handprint, which is one of the three items necessary to free Link from the Crystal as dictated by the Fairy's Scroll.

name: Hytopia
description: Hytopia is the kingdom that serves as the setting of Tri Force Heroes. It is ruled by King Tuft and his daughter, Princess Styla. It is home to many round eared Humans as they appear to be the predominant race and are called Hytopians.  Hytopia is a very fashion-forward kingdom, and a prophecy in the kingdom tells of three heroes who will come together to form a Totem. The kingdom was connected with Kingdom of Hyrule, located to the north of it, during The Era of Light and Dark. However, at a later period, possibly during the Golden Era when the kingdom of Hyrule expanded, the kingdom of Hytopia had seemingly merged with Kingdom of Hyrule.

name: Ice Ruins
description: The Ice Ruins is a dungeon in A Link Between Worlds. It is the remains of a hall that was buried and destroyed by the ice resulting from the perpetual winter conditions in Lorule's Death Mountain. Theme-wise, it is the counterpart of the Ice Palace in the Dark World but location-wise it is the counterpart of the Dark World's Turtle Rock. The Hookshot and the Fire Rod are required to access the Ice Ruins, and its boss is Dharkstare.

name: Ocean Sanctuary
description: The Ocean Sanctuary is a location in Spirit Tracks. It is found within the Ocean Realm.

name: Ikana Castle Front Gate
description: Ikana Castle Front Gate is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Death Mountain Summit
description: Death Mountain Summit is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lost Desert of Hanman
description: The Lost Desert of Hanman is a location mentioned in The Shadow Prince.

name: Darybon Plains
description: The Darybon Plains are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ice Cavern
description: The Ice Cavern is a recurring location and Dungeon in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Lost Hills
description: The Lost Hills are a location in The Legend of Zelda.

name: Zora Hall
description: Zora Hall is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Daval Peak
description: Daval Peak is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Icefall Foothills
description: Icefall Foothills is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Death Mountain Trail
description: Death Mountain Trail is a location in Ocarina of Time.

name: Zelo Pond
description: Zelo Pond is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Lost at Sea Station
description: Lost at Sea Station is a dungeon in Spirit Tracks. Its layout is a replica of the Temple of the Ocean King from Phantom Hourglass.

name: Dark World Shield Shop
description: The Dark World Shield Shop is a shop in A Link to the Past. It is located east of the Village of Outcasts. This shop is completely fenced in, with its only access point along the Northern perimeter. Link must jump a series of fences to even get in.

name: Deep Akkala
description: Deep Akkala is a sublocation of Akkala in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ibara Butte
description: Ibara Butte is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Dark Realm
description: The Dark Realm is a location in Spirit Tracks. It is a dimension of darkness that is connected to New Hyrule. It is the realm where the Demon Train is situated, which Chancellor Cole locates and later uses it to free the Demon King Malladus from his prison.

name: Ikana Village
description: Ikana Village is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Deep Woods
description: Deep Woods is a location in Skyward Sword. Considered to be the deeper and more dangerous part of the Faron Woods, it is accessible once Link has obtained the Slingshot from the Kikwi Elder, Bucha. It contains the first dungeon of the game, the Skyview Temple.

name: Darunia Town
description: Darunia Town, also known as the Mountain Town of Darunia, is a location in The Adventure of Link. It is a town among the mountains of the northwest coast of Eastern Hyrule.

name: Zauz Island
description: Zauz Island is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Ikana Hill
description: Ikana Hill is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Death Mountain Crater
description: Death Mountain Crater, also known as Death Mountain Summit, is a location in Ocarina of Time. It is the volcanic center of Death Mountain.

name: Yarna Desert
description: Yarna Desert is a location in Link's Awakening.

name: Death Mountain
description: Death Mountain is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. It is a tall, often volcanic mountain that can be found in Hyrule, the Dark World, and Lorule.

name: Zonai Ruins
description: The Zonai Ruins are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Dark Ore Mine
description: Dark Ore Mine is a location in Spirit Tracks.

name: Ikana Canyon
description: Ikana Canyon is a location in Majora's Mask. It is the eastern area of Termina. It is known to be a cursed land where the Ikana Kingdom once existed, being home to the dead and filled with spirits who linger with regret and hatred. The Garo Ninjas can also be found here spying on the deserted land.

name: Yiga Clan Hideout
description: Yiga Clan Hideout is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Darunia Lake
description: Darunia Lake is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Zokassa Ridge
description: Zokassa Ridge is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Dagah Keek Shrine
description: The Dagah Keek Shrine, designated by the Trial name Dagah Keek's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Zora Cape
description: Zora Cape is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Ze Kasho Shrine
description: The Ze Kasho Shrine, designated by the Trial name Ze Kasho Apparatus, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Zuna Kai Shrine
description: The Zuna Kai Shrine, designated by the Trial name Zuna Kai's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Dee Ess Island
description: Dee Ess Island is an island in Phantom Hourglass.

name: Yah Rin Shrine
description: The Yah Rin Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Weighty Decision, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Curiosity Shop Back Room
description: The Curiosity Shop Back Room is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Zora Village
description: Zora Village is a location in Oracle of Ages. It is an underwater village found in the Zora Seas of Labrynna. The village is inhabited mostly by Zoras, and is also home to the great Jabu-Jabu, where another Essence of Time resides. The Zora Village can only be reached after Link has obtained the Mermaid Suit and learned the Tune of Ages.

name: Zora Game Site
description: The Zora Game Site is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Hytopia Castle
description: Hytopia Castle is the seat of Hytopia's monarchical government in Tri Force Heroes, presided by King Tuft and his daughter Princess Styla. The castle is located directly within the town of Hytopia. It notably contains three Triforce-shaped portals, the Triforce Gateways, as the only known entrances to the Drablands.

name: Zora
description: The Zora, also known as the Zora Tribe, are a race in The Legend of Zelda series. The Zora are an aquatic folk who possess fish and amphibian like traits, including fins, webbed feet and gills, which allow them to swim and thrive underwater. Zora can come in many shapes and sizes, but are most commonly depicted as humanoids with long tail fins on their heads and finned appendages on their arms and legs. They are protectors of water.

name: Cucco Ranch
description: Cucco Ranch is a Minigame in A Link Between Worlds. Cucco Ranch can be found just south of Kakariko Village in Hyrule, and is operated by the Cucco Girl. Link must speak to the Cucco Girl, who will charge a different amount of Rupees depending on which difficulty he selects. The aim of the game is to dodge Cuccos flying overhead for the duration of 30 seconds in order to win a prize. The time and amount of Cuccos will increase with the difficulty of the selected mode. If Link is touched by a Cucco, he automatically loses the game.

name: Zirco Mesa
description: Zirco Mesa is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Woods of Winter
description: The Woods of Winter is a forested area in southeastern Holodrum in Oracle of Seasons. To the north of the woods is the Sunken City. To the west is Eyeglass Lake. The woods are accessed from the south via the Eastern Suburbs, which is just next to Horon Village. At the heart of the woods lies the second dungeon, the Snake's Remains. The woods are infested with Moblins, Leevers, Peahats and Like Likes.

name: Davdi Island
description: Davdi Island is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Zelkoa Pond
description: Zelkoa Pond is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Yoll Graveyard
description: The Yoll Graveyard is a location in the eastern region of present Labrynna in Oracle of Ages. It is home to the Spirit's Grave.

name: Crenel Peak
description: Crenel Peak is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Daka Tuss Shrine
description: The Daka Tuss Shrine, designated by the Trial name Sunken Swoop, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Zauz
description: Zauz is a character in Phantom Hourglass.

name: Woodfall Temple Pathway
description: The Woodfall Temple Pathway is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Yambi Lake
description: Yambi Lake is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Dark World
description: The Dark World, also known as the Evil Realm, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. It is a dimension parallel to the kingdom Hyrule, which is referred to as being a part the Light World in contrast, and a corrupted incarnation of the Sacred Realm. The Dark World debuted in A Link to the Past, making it the first of many realms alternate to Hyrule to appear in the series, the latter being Termina, the Twilight Realm, the World of the Ocean King, and Lorule.

name: Crater Cove
description: Crater Cove is a location in The Faces of Evil. Along with Goronu and Nortinka, it is one of the game's starting areas.

name: Ya Naga Shrine
description: The Ya Naga Shrine, designated by the Trial name Shatter the Heavens, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Zuna Village
description: Zuna Village is a location in Four Swords Adventures.

name: Cuho Mountain
description: Cuho Mountain is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Dark Hyrule Castle
description: Dark Hyrule Castle is the result of Vaati's power and is the sixth and final Dungeon in The Minish Cap.

name: Woodland Tower
description: The Woodland Tower is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: World of the Ocean King
description: The World of the Ocean King is the setting in which most of the events of Phantom Hourglass take place. It is home to the Ocean King as well as his spirits. It bears a striking resemblance to the Great Sea, and as such, Tetra and Link are not even aware that they are in another world during their adventures. The World of the Ocean King is connected to the neighboring Great Sea by water.

name: Crenel Wall
description: The Crenel Wall is a location in The Minish Cap.

name: Color Dungeon
description: The Color Dungeon is a dungeon in Link's Awakening DX. It was initially added to Link's Awakening DX to showcase the use of the Game Boy Color's screen to enhance gameplay. Link can enter the Dungeon as soon as he returns BowWow to Madam MeowMeow.

name: Zora Shop
description: The Zora Shop is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Cloud Tops
description: The Cloud Tops are located in the northeastern quadrant of Hyrule in The Minish Cap, above Veil Falls. They can only be accessed by the native Wind Tribe and "surface dwellers" who are "pure of heart". The Cloud Tops surround the Home of the Wind Tribe.

name: Courage Steppe
description: Courage Steppe is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Woodland Stable
description: The Woodland Stable is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Dah Kaso Shrine
description: The Dah Kaso Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Minor Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Clock Shop
description: The Clock Shop is a shop located in the center of Horon Village in Oracle of Seasons. Inside the shop, Link can find Tick Tock, its proprietor. Link cannot buy anything from the Clock Shop, its only purpose being for the Trading Quest, where Link trades Tick Tock a Wooden Bird for Engine Grease.

name: Yowaka Ita Shrine
description: The Yowaka Ita Shrine, designated by the Trial name Collected Soul, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild. It is exclusive to The Champions' Ballad DLC Pack.

name: Coral Reef
description: The Coral Reef is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Curtain of Twilight
description: The Curtain of Twilight is a location in Twilight Princess. It is the giant wall of Twilight that cascades over Hyrule.

name: Daag Chokah Shrine
description: The Daag Chokah Shrine, designated by the Trial name Daag Chokah's Blessing, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Crescent Island
description: Crescent Island is an eponymous landmass located on the southern seas in southeastern Labrynna, in Oracle of Ages.

name: Coldsnap Hollow
description: Coldsnap Hollow is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Zalta Wa Shrine
description: The Zalta Wa Shrine, designated by the Trial name Two Orbs to Guide You, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Chu Jelly Juice Shop
description: The Chu Jelly Juice Shop is a location in The Wind Waker. It is located next to the mansion of Windfall Island. It specializes on using Chu Jelly to make potions and it is run by the eccentric Doc Bandam. At first, the shop only offers the Red Potion. When Link gives him 15 Green and Blue Chu Jelly, Doc Bandam will be able to make Green and Blue Potion, respectively. Every time Link gives him 5 more Chu Jelly, the potion-maker will give the young hero a free sample of the new potion, either a red, green, or blue potion, depending on what type of jelly Link gives him. Even if he has already made that type of potion, he will still give Link a free sample.

name: Curiosity Shop
description: Curiosity Shop is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Champion
description: The Champions are a team of five chosen from the five races of Hyrule to battle against Calamity Ganon. Led by Princess Zelda with the Champion hero chosen by the sword that seals the darkness at her side, the other four Champions were tasked with piloting the Divine Beasts and providing back-up as Link and Zelda face the Calamity head-on in an attempted to seal it away.

name: Cliffs of Quince
description: The Cliffs of Quince are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Zodobon Highlands
description: Zodobon Highlands is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Tracy
description: Tracy is a recurring character in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Cliff Plateau Isles
description: Cliff Plateau Isles is an island of the Great Sea in The Wind Waker.

name: Chaas Qeta Shrine
description: The Chaas Qeta Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Major Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Coro
description: Coro is a character in Twilight Princess.

name: Crenel Hills
description: The Crenel Hills are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Woods of Mystery
description: The Woods of Mystery is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Compass Room
description: Compass Room are locations in Link's Awakening.

name: Corvash Peak
description: Corvash Peak is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: City in the Sky
description: The City in the Sky is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series. It is the seventh dungeon in Twilight Princess.

name: Dah Hesho Shrine
description: The Dah Hesho Shrine, designated by the Trial name A Minor Test of Strength, is an Ancient Shrine in Breath of the Wild.

name: Castor Wilds
description: Castor Wilds is a large, marshy area in western Hyrule in The Minish Cap.

name: Chamber of Sages
description: The Chamber of Sages is a location in Ocarina of Time.

name: Clock Town
description: Clock Town is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Cora Lake
description: Cora Lake is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Yarna Valley
description: Yarna Valley is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Castle Town Watchtower
description: The Castle Town Watchtower is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Castle
description: The Castle is a location in Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland.

name: Coast of No Return
description: The Coast of No Return is a location in Oracle of Ages. It is a small bit of coastline bordering the mysterious Sea of No Return in past age Labrynna. The shore is separated by a gap that Link can cross using the Switch Hook.

name: Cliffs
description: Cliffs is a location in Cadence of Hyrule.

name: Crescent Moon Island
description: Crescent Moon Island is one of the islands of the Great Sea in The Wind Waker.

name: Central Tower
description: The Central Tower is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Clock Tower
description: The Clock Tower is a location in the center of Clock Town in Majora's Mask.

name: Cape Cales
description: Cape Cales is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Chudley
description: Chudley is a character in Twilight Princess.

name: Woodfall
description: Woodfall is a location in Majora's Mask, situated within the Southern Swamp in Termina.

name: Castle Town Prison
description: The Castle Town Prison is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Chamber of Stone
description: The Chamber of Stone is a location in Twilight Princess.

name: Clarnet Coast
description: Clarnet Coast is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Corta Lake
description: Corta Lake is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Camera Shop
description: The Camera Shop is a house located in Tal Tal Heights in Link's Awakening DX.

name: Castle Graveyard
description: The Castle Graveyard is a location in Twilight Princess.

name: Central Square
description: The Central Square, also known as the Castle Town Central Square, is a recurring location in The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Chamber of the Sword
description: The Chamber of the Sword, also known as Inside the Statue of the Goddess, is a recurring location in the The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Coliseum Ruins
description: The Coliseum Ruins are a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Bug Rock
description: The Bug Rock is a location in Skyward Sword. It is small island inside the Thunderhead, inhabited by a large number of Bugs. It is also the location of Strich's minigame called "Bug Heaven."

name: Carok Bridge
description: Carok Bridge is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Kenzo
description: Kenzo is a character in Spirit Tracks. He lives alone in an isolated abode within the Snow Realm. He is a bridge worker and, like many characters and objects in Spirit Tracks, Kenzo's services are not necessary until later, once Link meets with Linebeck III, at the Trading Post.

name: Clock Town Bank
description: The Clock Town Bank is a location in Majora's Mask.

name: Camphor Pond
description: Camphor Pond is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Chamber of Giants
description: The Chamber of Giants is a mystical environment Link enters in Majora's Mask. Each time he defeats a Boss dwelling in one of Termina's four Temples and acquires its Remains, Link frees one of the Four Giants and meets it here. The true nature of this chamber is something of a mystery, and whether it is actually a physical location or something that exists on an incorporeal plain is not revealed.

name: Castle Underground Channel
description: The Castle Underground Channel is a location in Twilight Princess.

name: Castle Town Sewers
description: Castle Town Sewers, also known as the Castle's Waterway, and the Underground Waterway, is a location in Twilight Princess.

name: Central Hyrule
description: Central Hyrule is one of the eight Regions in Breath of the Wild.

name: Brazen Beak
description: The Brazen Beak is a location in Breath of the Wild.

name: Cafe Rafters
description: The Cafe Rafters are a location in The Minish Cap.

name: Cliffs of Ruvara

name: Bottom of the Well
description: The Bottom of the Well is a mini-dungeon in Ocarina of Time. It is located in Kakariko Village, more specifically at the bottom of Kakariko Well, which is also known as the Well of Three Features. It consists of an underground chamber that guards the Lens of Truth. On the whole, this dungeon is optional, having no effect on the main quest if not attempted. However, without the Lens of Truth, places such as the Haunted Wasteland, the Spirit Temple, the Shadow Temple, and Ganon's Castle will be more difficult to navigate. Also, Link may miss out on many treasures hidden throughout Hyrule that only the Lens of Truth can uncover.

name: Biron Snowshelf

name: Chambers of Insight
description: Chambers of Insight is a practice Stage in Four Swords. The Stage features various areas to practice with most of the game's many items as well as learn the different techniques that will be needed to complete each level and to defeat certain enemies. Throughout the Stage are Stray Fairies that will give the Links tips on how to complete their adventure. All of the Links must stand on the Warp Zones to be transported to the training area they wish to go to. In the middle of the chamber is a test that the Links can take to prove the skills they have learned. The mini-boss that must be defeated at the end is an Ice Wizzrobe.

name: Calatia
description: Calatia is a location in The Legend of Zelda comics by Valiant Comics. Located west of Hyrule, Calatia is the land from which Link is said to originate and also where his parents live during the events of the comic. Hylians seem to be the main population in this land, and they are led by Seline, queen of the country. Because this kingdom controls many important mountain passes to Hyrule,  if Calatia is ever captured by Ganon, he could easily take over Hyrule  as well.

name: Cafe Bar
description: The Cafe Bar is a location in The Wind Waker. It is located right next to Zunari's Shop, and it is one of the most popular hang-out places around Windfall Island. It was previously run by Gillian's father, but he has fallen ill and his daughter is now the one that manages it, although she does not seem to enjoy the job.

name: Beedle
description: Beedle is a recurring character in The Legend of Zelda series. He is a small-time businessman, seen working operating his various Shops. Like other Shops and Business Scrubs, Beedle sells, and sometimes even buys back, quest-specific items, such as All-Purpose Bait and Picolyte, both of which are not plot-required, but add extra interest to the games. Unlike the other entrepreneurial businesses in The Legend of Zelda series, Beedle incorporates memberships into his line of work, rewarding Link with increased price discounts if he becomes a frequent, repeat customer.
